Located within the iconic walls of CHIJMES since 1996, Tatsu Sushi is a traditional sushi bar with the vision of bringing authentic Japanese dining to Singapore. While we initially catered to the large community of Japanese residing in Singapore, the gradual acceptance of Japanese cuisine have boosted our patrons to include both locals and expatriates. Our restaurant features a traditional sushi bar serving fresh sashimi and sushi along with seasonal creations by our executive chefs. Our display counters uses the traditional method of maintaining our fresh fish; allowing our sashimi and oysters to be preserved naturally by resting over a bed of half-moon ice, ensuring constant low temperatures. Candle light alfresco dining is also very popular amongst our patrons. The wide varieties of raw fish available are strictly air-flown from Japan 4 times a week to ensure the utmost freshness. As a testament of our commitment to provide top quality dishes to our patrons, even our fruits are imported from Japan! Come try our specialities such as Aburi tuna belly , fresh Japanese oysters, grilled baby lobster as well as a wide range of sake to pair with.

Singapore's only beachfront hotel, Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort is located on the island of Sentosa, just 15 minutes from downtown Singapore, a perfect combination of a Resort within a City! Each of its 459 guestrooms has a private balcony overlooking the South China Sea or the lush hills of Fort Siloso. The Resort offers a range of leisure facilities, from the huge free-form swimming pool to a fully-equipped spa, as well as a sea sports centre. There's also a business centre to meet the professional needs of travellers.

5.text: Medan Steamboat Luton Van Dataran Bandaraya, Jalan Abdul Samad. It is located just beside the Dataran Bandaraya  - the building with the distinctive yellow clock tower. This is an open-air hawker center with almost 20 van stalls, with tables and chairs under plastic shelters. It specializes in 'steamboat', which is actually pieces of meat, seafood or vegetables on wooden skewers cooked in boiling water and then eaten with sauces. Business hours - typically from 6PM-2AM daily.

5.text: Referring to iron-plate cooking, Sho Teppan is a brand new dining concept that surfaced in 2009. Sho Teppan creates a fun, casual and no-frills culinary affair which allows customers to enjoy the thrill of cooking the meal themselves, just the way they like it. Unique and innovative, Sho Teppan is the first to offer both Teppanyaki and Sukiyaki under one roof. Wagyu Beef, Premium Black Angus, Kurobuta Pork Loin are just some of the few special items that diners will get to enjoy. And they are definitely spoilt for choice here. What's more, the portions are a good balance between quality and quantity. Each serving of meats, thinly sliced to perfection, is well measured at 150g per portion, giving diners a substantial meal that is worth every dollar. Sho Teppan's "Chef-less" concept, with no live kitchen, means there's a transparency to the restaurant. This only makes the ambience warmer and cosier, and not surprisingly, it's like your very own dining room!

5.text: Cumi Bali is a family-friendly restaurant, designed up by real people, unpretentious and simple. Artefacts brought from trips round Indonesia decorate the interiors and the walls. There are house specials which are highly recommended. Indonesian dishes are different from the regions' malay food as malaysian food tends to be heavy-handed on a couple of spices, whilst Indonesian cuisine uses spice blends or "Bumbu" to create the different lingering tastes of each dish. Check out for in house promo, Credit Card payment accepted above $40/-. Located along the stretch of bridal shops in Tanjong Pagar Road.

Welcome to GRUB, a fun bistro located in tranquil Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park. Food at GRUB is responsible, inspired and delicious. Opened by the guys from Cookyn Inc, GRUB brings the same message of awesome food to be shared with friends in a warm, fun and welcoming environment. GRUB is open now, ready to feed our friends & neighbours in Bishan, Ang Mo Kio and beyond! Directions:
Travel along CTE towards SLE and take exit Ang Mo Kio Ave 1. Continue for about 2km and turn left at Marymount Rd. Keep right for 450m and turn right to Sin Ming Ave. Travel along Sin Ming Ave for 800m and turn into first car park on the right . Grub is right across the bridge. Public Transport:
From Bishan MRT Station , take bus no. 52 or 410W . After passing The Salvation Army on your right, alight at the 3rd bus stop .

5.text:
La Cicala is a modern Spanish gastro bar with a chic, eclectic and contemporary design, featuring a full height  customed designed wine cellar and an extended wine tasting table housing an expansive selection of international wines. This gastro bar also features an impressive stainless steel and black mosaic tiled open kitchen flanked with  basalt cladded dining counter and raw black steel finished base, showcasing our gifted Chef de Cuisine and his team working their magic. The dining and lounge areas are enveloped by exposed timber beams, polished concrete floor, black smokey mirrored walls and accentuated by dramatic flying ceilings. exclusive signature bar for gin and tonics, with an extensive range of 24 different gins and 6 different types of tonic, serve with sitable garnish. Food and Beverage Concept
La Cicala pursues a concept of serving Pure Cuisine,  starting with pristine, wholesome and quality ingredients, our Chef de Cuisine creates dishes and tapas serving with a contemporary twist, anchored  in traditional Spanish gastronomy and inspired by Japanese grilling method. Our grill uses a special and exclusive Japanese white bamboo charcoal to impart a unique smokiness flavor to our dishes. Guests are invited to sit at our open kitchen and to interact with our chefs as they are preparing their composition. Our Chef de Cuisine regularly innovates and refreshes our menu with exciting new dishes. Our cocktails are expertly and attentively prepared by our mixologist using only the freshest ingredients, fruits and herbs.

At Stacked Dim Sum Bar, we've given the classic dumpling dish  - 'wantons', a modern, fusion spin. Expect to find your well-loved dim sum favourites and our original creations bursting with flavours using Thai, Italian and English ingredients. And who said dim sum can't be enjoyed at night? Pair your baskets of our specially handcrafted dim sum with one of our signature cocktails at sun-down for a complete dim sum bar experience. See you at Stacked! Week Day Promotion! Monday - Friday, 4pm - 11-30pm, 1 for 1 Drinks
Week End Highlights! Sunday, 4pm, Movie Screenings

5.text:
Our popular and signature dishes include our very own unique creation, "Cai Poh Hor Fun" . Egg lovers will enjoy this savoury main course flavored with "Cai Poh" which also comes with LOTS of additional prawns stirred right in. 
Dig into another one of the our signature dishes, the Braised Crab with Bee Hoon, which includes a tasty milky broth and a generous whole portion of crab with rice vermicelli. Hot favorite also includes the Chilli Crab & Salted Egg York Crab, we use top graded Sri Lanka Crabs of huge sizable portion 
Another signature dish is the Special Crispy Duck , a Chinese classic well known for its light and crispy skin which is fried yet not overwhelmingly oily. Premium items including shark's fin with crab meat , braised abalone with sea cucumber , fresh oysters  and xo sauce lobster  are also available at dean's cafe, which makes it a suitable place for special occasions and important extended family dinners.

Good Jap food at wallet-friendly prices. We want to make Jap food affordable and accessible for everyone! Jap food is big on freshness and we put our focus on that as well; No preheating, No micro-waved food. All dishes freshly made upon every order and applied with the same Jap culinary techniques one would find in
high-end restaurants. So come on down for a drink with us or just some Izakaya 居酒屋 fun. Gambai ~~
No GST. No service charge! We are nice people
P. s. last kitchen orders 1 hour before closing.

5.text: Wonderful Taiwan Delights has moved to this current location in August 2012 from its old premises at Jalan Leban, after around 9 years of operations there. We serve authentic and delicious Taiwan cuisine, dim sum, snacks, appetizers, homemade drinks & desserts, and more, all at an affordable price. Our spacious air-conditioned dining area and ample parking lots make our restaurant an ideal choice for simple meals with friends and family gatherings alike. We look forward to serving you, old and new customers alike.

5.text:
Verre Wine Bar aims to bring the appreciation of fine wine to everyone. With our signature central cellar tower rising out of our duplex warehouse conservation space, we seek to make good wine the centre of attention. At Verre, we strongly adhere to our founding manifesto: 
The Verre Manifesto
Verre believes that everyone should be able to taste, appreciate and savour fine wine, in a casual, unpretentious environment. Through our personal relationships with winemakers, producers and suppliers, we have hand-picked a comprehensive, high quality wine list, especially from France, the mother-country of wine. We support individual winemaker-families who are singularly dedicated to the traditional, artisanal craft of winemaking: showcasing the importance of terroir. We strive to debunk the theory that fine wine is inaccessible and the preserve of few. The democratization of wine is within reach, through our competitive prices and extensive, rotating wine-by-the-glass list. We promise to impart our collective wine knowledge to enhance your drinking experience. Come join the REVOLUTION! terroir   the combination of how geology, geography and climate bestow unique characteristics upon wine

By Reservation Only.

5.text: Indisputably, one of modern France's greatest treasures is its rich cuisine. The French have an ongoing love affair with food, and their reverence for time spent eating is evident in any culinary establishment nationwide. It is also manifested in the traditional family gatherings around the home dinner table, particularly the Sunday mid-day feast which is prepared lovingly over many hours and consumed leisurely through a bevy of appetizers and main courses, and often lively discussion which tends to center on political topics. Le Bistro Parisien is the first restaurant in the region to offer Halal French Cuisine. It offers a unique ambiance together with a homely setting which makes it a great venue for fine dining of classic french cuisine.

Lunch out?? Nah... just the usual canteens food...
BUT NOPE!!! Vänner is here to spark off your appetite~~~
Choose from a wide variety of sandwiches or main courses. How about a drink of aromatic coffee or tea? And a lil bit of music to relax your mind from the taxing work. A high-tea place for some ladies and gentlemen?? Help yourself to the cookies and drinks!!! Ah! It's happy hours with friends and colleagues!! How could you miss out Vänner?! Beers and wines for you? And a live band performance awaits!!! Come hang out with your frenz, chill at our cafe, relax and enjoy every single moment. That's what friends are about. And that's what Vänner is about!!

5.text: Honzen Cafe is established in early 2011. The name "Honzen" came about from the Chinese word "本然", which means "Natural". The word then translates to the Japanese word "Honzen". We want to bring out the Zen theme in our Cafe, where you can enjoy your meals or a cup of drink in a relaxing, peaceful and cosy ambience with our healthy selections. Honzen Cafe is set up with the intention to spread healthy vegetarian food benefits to the public. We would like to extend this passion to you, our customers. We have a wide selection of cuisines to choose from such as Chinese, Thai, Japanese and Western food. We use quality pearl rice, natural ingredients and serve a variety of healthy soup everyday. We also offer house drinks and various Enzyme vinegar drinks with healthy benefits. You will definitely be spoilt for choice each time you dine with us.

5.text: Being the first mover in the yet to be named culinary vernacular in the Singapore culinary landscape known as Haute Tapas, FoodBar DaDa has become a instant smash hit among food writers and local culinary circles. Prepared using the acclaimed Josper-grill, the tapas at FoodBar DaDa centres around only the freshest local produce which the kitchen team themselves source daily, combined with the best ingredients Spain and the region has to offer. Prepared in ways which best enhance their individual flavours, the dishes themselves are conduits for the creativity of DaDa chefs Jordi Noguera and Manel "the kid" Valero, and as such as become wonderful morsels of unpredictable deliciousness often infused with just the right touch of smokiness from the grill. At DaDa, the menu changes with the seasonality of ingredients and new tapas items are introduced on a very regular basis. DaDa also frequently welcomes visiting Spanish chefs on exchange programmes, who are often encouraged to inject their own personalities and soul into the tapas they are serving on that night. Cocktails lovers can also look forward to bespoke cocktails prepared by DaDa's mixologist team that includes Din Hassan, one of the best Singapore has to offer with over 25 years' experience in whipping up unique concoctions. While centred around industrial chic, DaDa nevertheless remains an intimate and inviting space with a layout which encourages diners to interact with the chefs and each other. The ambient lighting and groovy 70s disco, funk, Motown and blue jazz tunes also add to the overall chill atmosphere of this one-of-a-kind tapas bar.

5.text: Putera Puteri is a family run business which started as an interest in 2009 where siblings of the Haji Salli family started to take small catering orders for malay weddings which turned out to be a hit with its signature cooking of Nasi Briyani and vibrant decorations created by them. The traditional buffet spread of Malay and Indonesian dishes was the talk of the town in the community and since then the company grew in orders and the younger family members were roped in to carry out multiple tasking within the service Puter Puteri provided. With the name being more recognized by 2011 there were also request for other functions to carter and create deco themes for birthdays, engagements, child naming ceremony and many more. Our services are tailored to our client`s requirements and preferences in various choice of colour themes and menu selections. From traditional to contemporary food and decorations can be met by us. Come and sit with one of our marketing person for a chat for your BIG day and we will make it all memorable for you and your guests. Be it 50 guests or 5000 guests we will make it happen for you ! We will meet your needs from the start till the end just to put a smile on your faces on those important day which means alot to you. Coming from a humble background and to where we are today have only our past customers for their support to thank for. So do not hesitate to contact us for your future functions.

Batter Fluffy Flaps  is an all-day pancakes café! Come to our café to enjoy different combinations of the pancakes, there are savory and there are also sweet, there are even pancakes for the kids! Want to look at our menu? What is your favorite flavor pancake? If you cannot decide what you want, we also have 'create your own' where you can create your own flavor according to your liking on that day. You can also come into our café and just chill and have a drink which the recipe is homemade. We also have free WIFI in our café, and if you need to use our WIFI, just ask our people and we will provide you with the password! :D
So what are you waiting for? Come down to our café now and enjoy the great food, delicious drinks and our fantastic service! ;D See you there!

5.text: Welcome to Sapore Italiano! Sapore Italiano is the first Italian Lifestyle Caffè Bar inspired by the history and tradition of Italian bar culture. Here, you will find the distinct and authentic smells, sounds and flavors of Italy. The bar holds a special place in Italian society. At every corner, you'll find the sounds of life spilling out from the bar. It is the center of Italian social life. It's where we meet, eat, chat , discuss  and share a laugh. It's always informal and familiar, like a best friend's living room -- inviting, bustling and creatively chaotic and loud. We welcome you to embark on this gastronomical journey with us!

5.text: Set in a lifestyle destination off Dempsey Road, 22 Dempsey offers a wide range of dining and entertainment options in a stunning colonial bungalow, beautifully preserved to capture the charm of the area. An invigorating step away from the hustle of the city, 22 Dempsey has turned what was once a blank canvas into a brilliant mosaic of delicious food and drinks, along with lush gardens and one of the newest premium clubs in town. Perfect for weddings, events or a cosy dinner for two, the varied mix of influences and cuisines at 22 Dempsey promises something for everyone with an innovative spread, a wide selection of premium meats, hearty meals and all-day dining selections, as well as breath-taking cocktails paired with irresistible bar bites to provide the perfect end to the night.

5.text: Perched atop the forested Labrador Nature Reserve, the restaurant is perfectly reminiscent of the original Tamarind Hill Kuala Lumpur, preserving the milieu of being in a stand-alone historic colonial bungalow amid a vastly green surrounding. An ambiance fashioned by Tamarind's unmistakeable rustic-luxe Asian character and flair, the restaurant serves its traditional as well as contemporary Thai cuisine within this elegant venue just minutes away from the city. With 3 distinct dining areas, take pleasure dining on the outdoor lanai or inside the house in private corners and intimate sections. Your appetite impression begins with the welcoming colossal of a colonial-style long bar at the front of house. Flanked by a cozy Asian lounge, it suggests the perfect gambit for aperitifs. The restaurant boasts its exquisite backdrop which comes with a rare privilege - a wide green lawn that opens out to sea view - marking a most desirable venue for any event. Tamarind Hill will add its striking tribute to the Singapore dining scene as an elegant interlude for dinner or lunch, an atmospheric venue and one-of-its-kind for any party or occasion. A retreat by day, a holiday by night.

5.text: Hwang's is run by a husband and wife team, Mr. and Mrs. Hwang. They believe strongly in serving authentic and wholesome food to students at affordable prices. It all started in 1988, when two sisters started a Korean restaurant along Tanjong Pagar Road. Another outlet was formed to meet popular demand. Mrs. Hwang took over business of the latter outlet from her mother-in-law years later and was soon joined by Mr. Hwang. After several years of running the restaurant, Hwang's moved into NUS in July 2010, setting up a Korean stall at The Terrace Canteen. In November 2011, the restaurant at NUS University Town was opened.

5.text: PappaRich has around 100 outlets worldwide including Malaysia, Australia, China, Indonesia and now we have come to Singapore to give you a better choice of Malaysian Delights!!! At PappaRich you will be able to find authentic and delicious staple Malaysian cuisine in the urban city of Singapore. Designed as a cozy ambience with a trip down memory lane to the good old days for a family get together; or that familiar chit chat space with friends about everything under the sun, all these awaits you at PappaRich and you can indulge in all-time favorites such as PappaNasiLemak, Pappa Chicken Rice, Pappa Curry Laksa, Pappa Prawn Mee, and the deliciously rich and creative drinks menu that fits right to your stomach and warms right up to your heart. By staying true to its ingredients and ensuring top quality food is served, the lavish selection on our popular menu will leave you wanting for more. name.name: La Barca Ristorante and Wine Bar

5.text:
Hidden away in Katong, La Barca Ristorante & Wine Bar is a stunning restaurant set within the spacious grounds of the Goodman Arts Centre. Elegant, understated, and reminiscent of Milanese chic, no detail was overlooked in the design and furnishing of the space. The tables and sofas are original designs for La Barca and the chairs are by the legendary Viennese furniture maker Michael Thonet. Even the light bulbs were sourced from Sweden, to ensure the perfect ambience for its patrons. 'La Barca' -- the Italian word for 'boat,' was so named due to the shape of the site that it is situated on.
La Barca is helmed by Chef Michele Sorrentino. Chef Michele was the chef and owner of Antica Trattoria Botteganova in Siena, Italy until he sold it in 2009. Chef Michele received his Michelin star in 1999 and maintained it throughout the lifetime of his restaurant.

5.text: The Sushi Bar is a small cosy restaurant where we aim to let customers enjoy good Japanese food over a couple of drinks at an affordable price. Our staffs are friendly and should you want to know more about the food we are serving , you can ask the chef directly! No pretentious settings, no jacked up prices. 5.text: Empire State restaurant blends American dishes with Asian influences. Our talented chefs have come up with unique recipes designed to tantalise the Singaporean palate. We use only the best and freshest ingredients- our juicy patties are made from premium beef and we bake our buns with Japanese oatmeal flour to ensure freshness and quality. With our menu of soups, salads, pasta, pizza, ribs, burgers, hotdogs, milkshakes and irresistible desserts, you will be spoilt for choice. House specials include our giant 8-inch burger served with crispy fries, four cheese pizza, squid ink pasta, butternut squash soup, salmon tartar and a sizzling hot-plate brownie with ice cream topped with premium Belgian chocolate. Don't forget to try our delicious caramel banana walnut pancake from our all-day breakfast menu! Come join us at the Empire State Restaurant for a whole new world of American goodness made especially for you!

There's something about succulent grilled meats paired with ice cold beers that is extremely delightful. Introducing ROCKU Yakiniku, a casual, upbeat and edgy Yakiniku restaurant at the new Bugis+. Delivering a fresh concept to traditional Yakiniku joints, ROCKU Yakiniku defies convention by melding a traditional style of Japanese dining with modern entertainment, perfectly characterizing Japanese pop subculture. Known as one of the classic culinary styles from Japan, Japanese Yakiniku is a flaming charcoal grill experience that accentuates the pure characteristics of fine meats, poultry and vegetables. Guests can savour their food hot throughout the entire meal, and there's no better way to enjoy the tantalizing cuts of meat, ranging from beef to pork and chicken served at ROCKU Yakiniku. Flown in from the USA, Australia and Japan, premium cuts such as the Wagyu beef brisket, Australian sirloin and short ribs cater to all meat lovers. Other specialties such as Hotate Mentaiyaki , Saba fish, as well as an assortment of Tempura dishes promise a rocking experience. Located at the recently revamped Bugis+  opposite Bugis Junction, ROCKU Yakiniku is catered to the trendy, hip, and young at heart. The first "restaurantainment" concept of its kind, video creations of street images and of Japanese entertainment subculture are flashed on graffiti-splattered walls that are hand painted by renown Asian Urban Artist, Antz. Accompanied by indoor strobe lighting, the industrial feel of bare brick walls and metal easily transport guests into a dining and entertainment arena like no other. Apart from the multi-media entertainment, ROCKU also entertains and enthralls its guests with modern music of the Korean, Japanese and Mandarin Pop-Rock variety. With numerous spontaneous events to keep its guests entertained, coupled by an affordably priced menu with equally affordable beers, this hip joint is determined to be discovered.

5.text: Barbacoa opened on 11 November 2011. The restaurant specialises in traditional Barbeque, Roast and Grill. Barbacoa, pronounced as Ba-ba-kua, gets its name from the Taino people in the Caribbean, and the term means slow cooking of meat over the fire. The restaurant seeks to create a comfortable ambience for customers where they are able to savour delicious food at affordable prices. The restaurant is decorated with a Wild West and Mexican theme where customers are able to witness the frequent burst of dancing flames through a glass window as chefs cook the meats. Barbacoa's speciality items include our Full Slab Baby Back Ribs, which are marinated and slow cooked overnight with our in house recipe, served with savoury Hickory Smoked BBQ sauce. Another must try dish will be 'Cheesy Salsa Mushroom Chicken' panfried to perfection, crispy on the outside while juicy on the inside. For seafood and meat lovers, they are also the Traditional Fish&Chip, Salmon with seafood and Sirloin steak with seafood. Another unique dish will be our "Create your own Pasta", wherby customer can choose the way they want the pasta to be cook, creamy, olio or tomato base and add choices of ingredient ranging from vegetable/meat/seafood. Barbacoa Other must-try appetizers on the menu include 'Spicy cowboy wings' 'Assorted Sausages' as well as the Seafood Trio which comprises of Calamari, Prawn and Soft Shell Crab. In addition to their value-for-money set lunches and dinners. There is no service charge and no gst. Our staff do appreciate a tip if customers are pleased with their service and food. We are also open for private functions and bookings where customers can develop a fully customized menu for the event.

5.text: Our Tatsu Teppanyaki experience begins from your first step into our world. Feast your eyes on our Chefs' acrobatic performance while being ushered to your seats. Our dishes are created to fully tantalize even the most discerning taste buds. Strong tasting, bold flavours and mixtures of alcohol and sauces will definitely be a hit for the adventurous. While for the sensitive palate, we offer a milder option upon special request. Our style of teppanyaki allows your party to dine at a comfortable and relaxing pace. Chefs are trained to manage their cooking performances and serve each course at intervals allowing time for savouring food and conversation in between bites. The bar counter setting provides each and every diner with direct access to the chef, allowing everyone to experience the theatre unfolding before their eyes. Candle light alfresco dining is also available outside. Be it a casual work lunch or fine-dining dinner with your date, that important networking session to impress your clients effortlessly or a decadent Sunday family treat to acrobatic 'live' performances accompanied with quality food, Tatsu Teppanyaki will delight young and old alike.

5.text: Osteria Mozza and Pizzeria Mozza is Mario Batali's first venture into Asia, marking another milestone for the chef who has 14 restaurants, eight cookbooks and a host of television shows under his name. Both restaurants will be almost exactly as they are in California, providing two different dining experiences within the same venue. The centerpiece of the refined and elegant Osteria Mozza is the Mozzarella Bar where a wide array of fresh items from mozzarella, burrata, bocconcini and stracciatella are prepared. The live action behind the Mozzarella Bar warrants a gastronomic and sensational experience for diners at Osteria Mozza. The full liquor bar is backed by a stunning millwork feature and spills onto white marble bar tops where guests can gather to enjoy items from the mozzarella bar. Other menu items include artisanal salumi and handmade pasta along with seafood and meat dishes.

5.text:
Kome Japanese Dining - An exciting culinary adventure
Set in the Keppel Club's spacious green grounds, Kome Japanese Dining is the perfect venue for a relaxed dining experience for all occasions. From business lunches, family gatherings to birthday parties, we serve Set Meals, Ala Carte Buffet to Omakase  to suit your needs. Omakase - For an adventurous dining
Japanese seasonal cuisine is the specialty here and Omakase is popular with regular diners here. Seafood is dominant on the menu, and the 13-seat sushi counter is the main stage for our chef to exhibit his flair for preparing sushi and sashimi with fresh seasonal delicacies flown in every Tuesday and Friday from Tokyo Tsukiji market, Japan. Stars on the Ala Carte Menu
On the Ala Carte menu, the Butakakuni  is heavily marbled and melts in the mouth. Also on the menu is Foie Gras Gindara Shioyaki . The simple method of salt grilling allows the natural taste of the fish to remain intact. Fukahirei Chawanmushi, or Shark's fin egg custard is yet another delicacy that wooed our diners with its smoothness. Best of Japanese cuisine all in the Ala Carte Buffet
Available for dinner from Monday to Friday and all-day on Saturday, Sunday & Public Holidays, our wide selection from the best of Japanese cuisine is set to tantalize your taste buds. Value for Money Teishoku
If you prefer no-frills dining, tuck into our regular set meals to beat the lunchtime rush hour. Kome Bento and Beef Sukiyaki Teishoku are popular with our customers. Starting from only $18-80+, Kome set meals are perfect for great food at great value!

5.text: Grab those boots and faded jeans, and saddle up for a culinary journey Southwest! Santa fe tex-mex grill, located on the main deck of the riverboat, brings the flavours of america closer to you with its authentic texan-mexican favourites like quesadillas, nachos, chimichangas, tacos, baby-back ribs, and sizzling-hot fajitas. Tex-Mex Cuisine identifies an Americanization of Mexican food. There is a strong reliance on Mexican ingredients such as cheese, beans, onions, bell peppers, and tortillas, as well as a distinct American influence. Tex-Mex cooking is modern and trendy, and has been described as being 'as bright and colourful as sunny Texas and Mexico'. Santa Fe was among the first to introduce this delightful flavour to Singapore at its first outlet at Boat Quay way back in 1999.

Group Therapy is a collective space that is tucked away on the 2nd storey of a reconstructed shophouse in the newly gentrified Duxton enclave. We believe that the best form of nourishment for the soul is forged through inter-personal relationships from common interests and values -- hence the name 'Group Therapy'. The space is deliberately secluded for groups to gather and seek respite in the heart of the CBD. The interiors are left raw and the décor maintaining a simplicity and authenticity to allow the imagination to run with the possibilities of the space. Group Therapy is mainly an event space, having held wine tastings, dinner parties, media launches & corporate workshops. Our adjunct café is an expression of our love for nourishment through coffee, food and good drink. Our beans are a tailored blend of 100% Arabica beans, which are freshly ground on premise for each and every cup. Our menu serves All-Day Breakfast items  such as Poached Eggs  & Smoked Salmon on Thick Toast as well as other lunch items like Paninis, Pies & Stews. We love to shout about our dessert and unique menu of boutique beers, which boasts an amazing 4-layer carrot cake as well as the award-winning Coedo Beniaka & Delirium Tremens brews. Just to make sure we don't leave the non-coffee drinkers out, we also carry a selection of JING teas, ciders, and boutique wines. So we hope you will drop in to say HI soon and for some coffee, tea & our kind of Therapy !

name.name: Bayview At ECP Seafood Centre/ Bayview At Singapore Flyer

5.text: When it comes to a truly unforgettable dining experience, it's not just the scrumptious fare and cordial service that matter. The ambience in which you dine in is of significance too, as what better way to savour delectable dishes than to soak in the comfort of a scenic setting coupled with a mind-blowing view of the sea at East Coast Park, having the gentle sea breeze caressing your face while feasting your eyes on titillating performances by beautiful belly dancers. Nasrin Ocean Persian & Seafood Cuisine offers you all that and more! Come indulge in exotically wonderful Persian Seafood cuisine which is a refreshing change from all the other cuisine types out there. Persian cuisine is diverse, with each province featuring dishes, culinary traditions and styles distinct to its region. At Nasrin Ocean, to achieve a rich and balanced taste, characteristic Persian flavourings such as saffron, dried limes, cinnamon and parsley are mixed delicately and used in some special dishes. Experience an explosion of exotic flavours that are bound to ignite your taste buds and satisfy your palate while you are entertained by a troop of gorgeous belly dancers who will shimmy and enthrall you with their exotic movements. An all-round mystical dining experience awaits you.

5.text: Whether you are looking for a cosy intimate meal, a family outing or a place to entertain your clients, you need to go no further. Mirchi - Taste of India offers you a delectable range of kebabs, mouth watering curries and a wide range of authentic dishes from the North. The selection of food delivers flavors of remarkable complexity and intensity, remaining true to classic Indian recipes, but also reflecting the food trends in today's India. Come and enjoy pre dinner cocktails by the bar amongst a modern yet casual dining setting that is sure to impress. The establishments are also available for private events and bookings.

5.text: Newton Food Centre is a major food centre located in Newton, Singapore. The food centre was promoted by the Singapore Tourism Board as a tourist attraction for sampling Singaporean cuisine. 5.text: Zafferano is Singapore's newest cosmopolitan restaurant, bar and lounge destination that takes dining to the next level - literally. Uniquely situated on the 43rd floor of the Ocean Financial Centre at Collyer Quay, the venue exudes stylish dining with a backdrop of an incredible 270-degree panoramic view of the skyline from above. At Zafferano, Italian dining is an unmatched multi-sensory experience: from our delectable dishes to 40 wines By The Glass. Zafferano is set to become Singapore's ultimate sophisticated haven for those looking for an authentically stylish atmosphere of plush interiors and stunning views of the city. Appetisers like Uovo , made with parmesan cream, poached organic egg, green asparagus & black truffle, the Foie Gras , made as a terrine with figs, pistachio, vin santo and a side of toasted brioche, are a must-try. Another recommended appetizer is the Degustazione di Prosciutto  of three tasting hams -- parma ham, san diele and pata negra bellota. For mains, sink your teeth into the signature Filleto , a pan-fried US prime-grade beef tenderloin with goose liver, mashed potato, vegetables and marsala sauce. An Italian restaurant is nothing without its pasta offerings! Zafferano's Astice  with large paccheri pasta, Boston lobster and cherry tomatoes, as well as Risotto Zafferano , a saffron-flavoured risotto made with creamy goose liver, quail leg confit and black truffle will truly hit the spot. Those with a sweet tooth are far from forgotten! The Fragole  is a unique strawberry soup with yogurt ice-cream and candied lemon. Chef De Franco also offers two kinds of Tiramisu, the classic, and the Tiramisu al Frutto della Passione, made with passion fruit, strawberry & mint sauce and crunchy caramel pistachios .

Himalaya Kitchen serves North Indian,Nepalese,Pakistani, Punjabi and Indian-Chinese Foods. At HimalayaKitchen, we cook every dish using only the freshest, finest ingredients. We serve only the choicest meats and seafood, freshest rice and beans. Our authentic menu and atmosphere create a truly enjoyable dining experience. We use only organic ingredients.
We cook every dish when you order. Come taste the difference at HimalayaKitchen! HimalayaKitchen provides catering services and has been creating great meals and great memories for more than a year. Call HimalayaKitchen today; we'll take care of everything. With HimalayaKitchen you don't need to worry about a thing. We take care of all the details, from preparation to clean up. We fix our prices up front. Our team of highly qualified professionals will make any event a pleasure. From weddings to cocktail parties, or anything in between. HimalayaKitchen is your best choice. Our attention to detail, experience, and reliability ensure that your event will be a success without any problem. Our food reflects our commitment to exceptional quality. All meals are prepared under the guidance of Chef BhimBhadur, one of our experience and most renowned chefs. All meals are prepared with a passion for perfection. Your guests will be talking about your wonderful food for days to come
We cater for all types of events.

5.text: db Bistro Moderne, offers an exciting mix of traditional French bistro cooking and contemporary American flavors with a world renown signature burger collection. Chef Daniel Boulud re-interprets the classic Parisian bistro while sharing the energy and style of the famed original db Bistro Moderne in Midtown Manhattan. The striking design by Jeffrey Beers is decidedly contemporary with references to traditional bistro aesthetics. In addition to a welcoming dining area, db Bistro Moderne also includes a stylish 15 seat bar as well as an informal bar dining area and two private rooms. The restaurant is located in The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands Resort .

5.text: Your favourite seat by the sea! Scruffy Murphy's Irish Café-Pub is a cosy Irish seaside cottage by the calm shores of Singapore's East Coast. Scruffy's has been serving up great food and drinks been opened for 5 years now as part of Gaelic Inns Group and is well known for the quality and variety of its home-cooked food, and of course the friendly service from its staff. With the beach in the background and the fresah sea breeze, Scruffy Murphy's makes the perfect venue for chilling out mid week eves after work and throughout the weekend with friends or family customers to lounge whilste enjoying the good food, ice cold draught beer, and of course the sea view! The outdoor beer terrace outdoor open air beer garden at Scruffy's is light, airy and casual and surrounded by the natural greenery of the East Coast Park, Singapore's most popular weekend playground. The cottage style main bar is ideal for a drink with friends, whilst and there is a more private air-conditioned lounge towards the rear of the bar  - suitable for private functions or gatherings. Offering all day breakfasts, lunches and dinners aton the weekends and great home-cooked food for dinner on weekdays, Scruffy's is popular with both the local and expatriate community in Singapore as there's always something for everyone.

We've got freshly prepared sandwiches and not-just-for-kids milkshakes. Not forgetting the ever popular "Fry Up"- a full breakfast plate served all day. Set in what used to be colonial quaters in Wessex Estate, this peaceful neighbourhood is now an artist village surrounded by greenery and beautiful black and white bungalows. Wessex Tavern is definately a little escape from that hectic city life where our tavern family provides down-to-earth hospitality to everyone.

The Market Grill provides visitors an option of simple and generous portions of freshly grilled market produce.

5.text:
Welcome to Fordham & Grand. Our Story...
Fordham & Grand is an unsophisticated bistro. We welcome those who enjoy the art of revelry. Each night we seek to create a simple yet entertaining experience through the mediums of delectable food and intriguing beverages. Our goal is not to challenge you with technical and sophisticated food or beverages. We want you to feel the comforts of the everyday without the care or worry of the world on your shoulders. We want to take you on a journey into the realms of the Sandman as we glide into the small hours of the morning. Fordham & Grand is for the nightjars and the late night adventurer. Everyone is welcome. Our Food... We are serving unsophisticated bistro food. Simple and enjoyable food, that is interesting and seductive. Our dinner menu will feature rustic dishes that are familiar to your palates but will intrigue you, not on the molecular level, but rather on the unique combination of flavours, textures and presentation aspects. Our supper menu, which will be available until 2am, will focus more on the sharing and communal aspects of dining. Simple, easy to share dishes that will satisfy the ravenous belly. We are creating dishes that we would enjoy and that we hope you can enjoy alone, with friends or with your favourite book. Our magic number is 100. We have carefully selected 100 wines under $100. This aspect of our wine list will allow you to explore the wonderful world of viticulture without breaking the bank. We have not focused specifically on the old world or the new world nor have we limited ourselves to the popular grapes or varietals. Our wine list is a harmonious balance between all aspects of the wine making world. Come and explore this world with us one glass at a time or a few bottles at a time , and stay well within your budget. Oh, did we mention we will have some of the finest Champagnes in the world for under $100. Our Cocktails... There will be no mixology or fanciful garnishes. There will be no dry ice or the carving of perfectly spherical ice balls. There will be no waiting because the bartender must perform a ritualistic hard shake . What we will be serving is a unique interpretation of the classic cocktails that you all know and love. The art and romance of a cocktail will not be lost at Fordham & Grand. We will stir, shake and build your delicious tonic using the freshest of fruits, the finest of liquors and with every ounce of passion we have. We are here to quench your thirst and satisfy your craving for a beautifully crafted concoction without the hustle and bustle. "I don't have a drinking problem 'Cept when I can't get a drink. Why so late? We understand that a good party never ends. Opening from 6pm until 3am seven days a week gives you the opportunity to finish that catch up with your friend or have that small treat after the hard day of work . It also gives you the chance to continue your party in a place where revelry is welcome, no matter how small the hour is in the morning. At Fordham & Grand we will always be there to satisfy your hunger and quench your thirst. Come and join us every time the sun sets and tipple with us until the stars stop shining. What does Fordham & Grand mean? We are named after a very cultural area and street intersection of the Bronx. Fordham Road and Grand Central was once one of New York's most cultural and vibrant places. A lot of money and culture could be found in this area. This culture gave way to some of the most interesting  Art Deco architecture in the world. Being so cultural and vibrant and in the midst of the Prohibition, the area was also home to many great "speak easy" bars. For us, we have taken this beautiful amalgamation of the many great aspects of an exciting era and brought it to the contemporary age. The unique period of Art Deco, the "speak easy" culture of the Prohibition and the vibrancy of New York's most famous borough, the Bronx, can be found at Fordham & Grand.

5.text:
Saveur is the brainchild of two young and enterprising friends who decided to pursue their dreams. After stints at various fine diners like Guy Savoy, Fifty Three and Tetsuya's in Sydney, they discovered that there is a need to provide quality French fare at affordable prices. Armed with an entrepreneur rigor and wit, Saveur was set up. 
Saveur prides herself as a restaurant that offers quality yet affordable French cuisine to the masses. Saveur aims to serve her own interpretation of French food, bringing French cuisine to everyone using local products at down-to-earth prices. Thus, bringing a whole new gastronomic experience to all.

5.text: Paulaner Bräuhaus is located in a unique three-storey glass building at Millennia Walk. Customers can soak up the boisterous atmosphere at the bar and beer garden on the first level with live entertainment, while savoring authentic and freshly brewed-on-the-premise German beers by our resident brew master. The restaurant on the second level offers a taste of Bavaria with Executive Chef Klaus Lukarsch at the helm, serving up delectable selections of traditional German fare that can be wonderfully paired with our freshly brewed beers. The gallery on the third level caters to special functions. With an extensive menu boasting Munich specialties  as well as popular international dishes and food trends, you can be sure identical recipes are used in all brew houses worldwide and applied according to Bavarian standards. Selected 'Must-Try's found in our well-established menu are crispy pork knuckle with sauerkraut and bread dumpling, 'Paulaner sausage pan' with 5 different sausages on sauerkraut, and caramelised Bavarian emperor's pancake with apple plum compote. Whether it's Munich Lager or Munich Dark, beers are available all year round with seasonal brews during special festivals like Salvator, Maibock, and Oktoberfest. Due to the expert craftsmanship of our brew master you can be sure our beers are always fresh from the tap.

5.text:
A stone's throw from the commercial bustle of the Orchard/Tanglin shopping belt, Backyard@Dempsey sits in a quaint little nook just off the new and very hip Dempsey catchment of F&B establishments. Beautiful by day and lovely by night, Backyard is unpretentious, laid back and set amidst lush and mature greenery, making it the ideal getaway for the frazzled and those seeking a brief respite from the everyday hustle and bustle of Singapore. Enjoy a sumptuous meal with the family or simply kick back and unwind over a pint of fruity Kronenbourg with your best mates; absorb yourself in that new book you've been meaning to read over a cuppa aromatic coffee or relax and pour over our selection of magazines whilst sipping a refreshing iced tea; even bring your laptop and spend a lazy afternoon surfing the web or clearing some emails over our free wifi. So slide into your comfiest T, let your hair down, don those berms, lose the tie and even slip into flip flops and make Backyard your very own.
The kitchen serves up both western and local favorites all day, good ol' comfort fare you can tuck heartily into. Beverage promotions abound for those on a more liquid diet and refreshing cocktails blend perfectly with the tropical alfresco setting. Complimenting the happy hours  is a wide selection of bar snacks which go great with quaffing down those beers or simply as a mid-afternoon, early evening bite to last you till dinner. With its great central location, laid-back charming ambiance, good food and drinks at pretty palatable prices, ample free gravelled parking lots just steps away, it's a proposition that's hard to resist! Backyard... Your Nook In The Woods!

5.text: Meet Lucha Loco, Singapore's first Mexican taqueria which meets two critical needs in your life - gourmet Mexican street food and crazy Mexican wrestling. Just to be clear, you aren't going to get assaulted by Mexican wrestlers flying in your direction when you walk through the door - we are a casual 100 seat restaurant and garden bar serving some of the finest Mexican street corn, ceviches, taco's, and other tasty Mexican delights served north of the border. With a menu created by Chef Jason Jones  and our very own loco Chef Mario Malvaez from Mexico City, our tasty taco's, sensational margaritas and super fine mezcal and tequila is going to keep you coming back for more. No reservations. Walk-in only. However we do accept group bookings for groups of 8 pax or more.

5.text: The third Hard Rock Cafe in Singapore is located in the heart of The Forum in Sentosa island. Featuring world's famous American menu mixed with regional favorites that will surely whet your appetite. Each dish stamped with the personality of the creative genius in charge of the kitchen of Hard Rock Cafe. No matter whether you're savoring a rare new york Strip Steak or the HRC Legendary Burger, you can rest assured that they are of US Choice & Certified Australian Angus Beef. Boasting a beautifully conceived dining room, the superior luxury of a vast collection of music memorabilia finds their perfect spaces on the walls, a stylish contemporary lounge bar are one of those rare experiences which go some way to establishing Hard Rock Cafe as one of the globe's culinary hot-spots. Whilst at the Cafe, don't forget to check out an amazing collection of souvenirs, mementos and collectible items at our Rock Shop!

Café de waraku and Mr Curry is a restaurant that has two different concepts. Café de Waraku
A Café that has an relaxing and vibrant ambience for all ages to enjoy with our signature dessert the  Earthquake Hanito and our Japnese waffle that surprise most guest to our mouth watering Omu Rice with the different combination with 2 different type of rice to choose from. Mr Curry
We have MR CURRY from the Curry Land to welcome our guest of all ages at the entrance of the restaurant. Curry is the concept used in this restaurant and as most of our food in here are associate with curry. With 4 different types of curry  -- the Mr Curry original, Red Curry , White Curry  and the Black Curry  in your curry rice , you will be spoilt for choices. Our spicy level in the curry has 3 different level to your liking. For the risk taker - the very spicy, the Moderate taker - the spicy level and to those who are are not able to eat any ounce of spicy food? Fret not! We have our own special Non Spicy Curry where you can enjoy! Now even the children can enjoy the same food with their parents. So come down now to enjoy!

5.text: Part of the "Les Amis" group of restaurants and situated in a restored 1920s residence in the Gardens. The food is mostly French with some other European dishes thrown in and many given a little Asian twist, but given the very high prices the quality is a little wobbly. There is a superb wine list and a very helpful sommelier on hand to answer questions. The views of the garden are gorgeous. Enter through the Corner House Gate and follow signs to Au Jardin/EJH Corner House . Reservations recommended.

Situated amidst the lush greenery of Bukit Timah, Little Diner is a place of respite from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Make no mistake, we are not a fine dining establishment, serving haute cuisine on small plates. Instead we serve hearty food that feed the hungry and invigorate the weary. There is no pretense; just honest, good comfort food. We seek to embody the concept of a local diner, your go-to place for great eatz in generous portions. We urge you to make Little Diner your home as much as it is ours. Come to a place where the food is great, and friends are made. Homemade food better than yer mama's....just don't tell her...! Our executive chef, Michael Quinn hails originally from Kerry, Ireland. Having lived in New York City for the past 12 years, he has combined both Irish and American philosophies towards food. Believing in "simple food, done right," he sources out the freshest produce, letting the natural flavors speak for itself. The menu is reflective of the seasonality. In using seasonal ingredients, we let Mother Nature's best shine through!

The Royal Mail Restaurant & Bar is a 60-seater establishment housed within the historical and culturally-rich Ascott Raffles Place and serves modern interpretations of Classic British Cuisine where Roasts and Prime Rib take 
centre stage. A vintage brass mail chute, which stands in its full glory by the lift lobby of the Ascott, is the inspiration for The Royal Mail concept which provides guests with a touch of Old World elegance from the days of letter-writing, Doris Day, Grace Chang and policemen in shorts. Parking is available Hong Leong Building or 
John Hancock Tower . Opening hours:

5.text:
Dear all the people in Singapore,
We are Japanese poultry farmers "TSUKADA NOJO". Our first restaurant outside Japan will be opened in Singapore in October 2012. Our own farm "tsukada nojo" is located in miyazaki-southern kyushu-1000 km away south from tokyo, japan. Here, surrounded by nature, we are raising precious chickens called "JITOKKO" that grows only this area. "JITOKKO" is a very valuable brand chicken in Japan. This chicken is raised in an organic way with thorough quality control further than the government's stringent standards. This chicken is shipped only by limited number of farmers. That is why this is called "rare chicken". In tsukada nojo singapore, we serve you  a collagen soup beauty pot made by this nourishing "jitokko", and other popular menu in japan. We are looking forward to seeing you soon! Please enjoy! TSUKADA NOJO farmers

Evoking the soul of the small seafood eateries that dot Boston, we serve all these and more in a fun and energetic atmosphere with authentic flavours and great service. 5.text: Maggie Thai & Chinese Restaurant established in 1998. It is conveniently located at the heart of the city, only minutes away from Bugis Junction. Its founder, Auntie Maggie was borne in Thailand a Chinese family. In her childhood, she helped her mother to prepare meals for the big family. She learnt Thai and Chinese culinary arts then. Married with a Singaporean and migrated to Singapore, she stated her first Thai food stall at Queen Street hawker centre. It soon became a famous eatery outlet. Customers packed up in an endless queue at busy hours. Encouraged by customers, Maggie and her family decided to move the business to Liang Seah Street in 1998 starting with only one shop unit. Maggie Thai & Chinese Restaurant was established since there. Years later, it was expended to two shop units. Despite the high rent of the city central area, it insists to provide "cheap and good" food for working class and residents. Maggie retired in 2011. While enjoying her retirement with frequently travelling abroad, Maggie kept learning culinary arts and brought back new recipes from elsewhere. Thanks Maggie, we now have introduced a lot of new dishes to our valued customers. Please come to experience our fine Thai and Chinese culinary arts.

5.text: With almost 60 years of ramen making experience behind them, Uma Uma Ramen makes its entry into Singapore at Forum the Shopping Mall! Uma Uma Ramen's name stems from "Wu Maru", a Ramen shop established in 1953 by the father of Uma Uma Ramen's current President, Masahiko Teshima. Upon taking over the business in 1994, "Wu Maru" was renamed "Uma Uma Ramen"; a play on the original name of the restaurant as well as a pun on the Japanese word for "tasty". Uma Uma serves delicious noodles, made according to a family recipe, with a robust and aromatic tonkotsu stock.

5.text: Live Seafood. Famous Crab Dishes on offer. Open for private function, Reservation, Take away. Traditional and Alfesco Dinning Experience. Call for reservation. Famous MELLBEN Seafood is now open at opal crescent. MELLBEN serve only the freshest crabs, which are delivered daily to the restaurant. Singapore raves over MELLBEN's heavenly crab dishes! It needs no further introduction. Renowned for our Claypot Crab Beehoon, Chili Crab, Golden Sand Crab, many food lovers have braved storm to queue up at our heartland outlet for a taste of our crab dishes. MELLBEN seafood, a family run business in Alexander, then in Pasir Ris, Ang Mo Kio, Toa Payoh. We have more then 20 years experience in the crab food business. And now New Outlet at East Coast Parkway. We have introduce a New Crab dish which is only available at this outlet, The LAKSA Crab Beehoon. Combining a local delight with our juicy Crab. A dish not to be missed!! Call for reservation now!

5.text:
We're a vintage restaurant located in a 1920's converted shophouse in the colorful Chinatown district on the fringes of Singapore's CBD. In this day and age when we are constantly rushing to get from one place to another, folks collective hopes to provide a place where people from all walks of life can come together to wind down, relax and seek solace from the company of family and friends. We have an emphasis on Thai food , but really, we simply cook food that we ourselves feel like eating. We love what we make in our kitchen, and we hope you would too.
Please contact us at hello@folkscollective for enquiries and reservations.

5.text: Founded 2011 January. "Xin" is English pronunciation for the Chinese character "新". Key founders of New Soon Huat Pte Ltd were ex-offenders whom have broken away from their old habits and start NEW lives. The mission of new soon huat is to be our customers' favorite place to go for delicious chinese delicacies and offer career opportunities to people in oour community who wants a new start. At Xin, we serve hot, delicious local chinese specialties such as Bak But Teh, braised Pig Trotter, Ginger Chicken, Steam Pomfret, Big intestines, Fresh Mushroom soup and many other local delights. One of our signature dish is dry bak kut teh - recommended by our main chef. Our Bak Kut Teh is different from the Teochew/Hokkien Bak Kut Teh. New Soon Huat's Bak Kut Teh comes in a claypot and ingredients includes innards brewed with herbs and spices. Our Bak Kut Teh style is more towards Klang Style.

5.text:
G7 Express Cafe is a compact and stylish mini-cafe that offers delicious and authentic Vietnamese baguette sandwiches and uniquely brewed Vietnamese iced coffee. Perfect for young urbanites who are always on the lookout for tasty yet healthy meals, G7 Express Cafe brings to Singapore Vietnam's world-renowned banh mi sandwiches and iced coffee. LOVE AT FIRST BITE. You will surely love our baguette sandwiches! Here's why:
Fresh Baguette with crackly crust and soft inside . Vietnamese chilies for some hot sensation. Uniquely flavored Vietnamese filling that is sure to please your palate 
Pickled carrots and daikon radish for exotic flavor
Cucumber strips for a refreshing taste
Fresh coriander and spring onion for added zest
Chicken pate spread  to complete this great exotic sandwich! A cup above the rest. Only the best coffee from Vietnam, uniquely-brewed, goes into every cup of G7 Express Cafe coffee: 
Premium Coffee Quality -- we  use Vietnam's famous Trung Nguyen coffee in all of our coffee drinks, considered by coffee connoisseurs as one of the world's best 
Unique Cold Brew process -- by using unique cold brewing process , our coffees have smoother bodies and less acidity 
Smooth and Strong -- smooth as silk and kick ass strong without the bitter or burnt taste
Great Value for Money -- better than Western coffee at almost half the price
Do yourself a favor and visit us now!

5.text: The oasis taiwan porridge restaurant which has been in business for more than 38 years is now located at toa payoh town park that is opposite the hdb hub and next to the toa payoh swimming complex. It was previously located next to the Indoor Stadium and opposite the old National Stadium. Parking should not be a problem as there are ample parking lots at the car park in the HDB Hub and the Toa Payoh Swimming Complex that is only a 1 min walk to the Oasis Taiwan Porridge restaurant. The eatery which offers delicious value for money food retains its old charm and ambience. The informal atmosphere, characterised by the cacophony of background noise of diners' chitchat, punctuated occasionally by outbursts of laughter, reminds one of a traditional dim sum restaurant. The Oasis Taiwan Porridge restaurant is unique - Diners can feast their eyes on the picturesque mature garden with its bamboo and willow trees and pond while enjoying their meal. For more than 38 years, the Oasis Taiwan Porridge restaurant's mainstay has been the humble Taiwan porridge, a traditional staple for many Asians. Patrons old and young have downed countless mouthwatering bowls of pearly white rice grains boiled to perfection with chunks of hand-picked fragrant sweet potatoes. The piping hot gruel is light, fat-free and easily digested. The free flow of the porridge makes a perfect complement to the myriad of delectable dishes whipped up by our experienced chefs who are able to churn out hot favourites at an alarming pace that do not compromise food quality. While the restaurant has introduced interesting new cuisine to cater to diners' need for new tastes, traditional signature dishes like promfret with bean sauce, stewed pork in traditional taiwanese style, bean sprouts with salted fish, sambal kangkong, lean minced meat marinated with golden brown salted egg yolk, braised beancurd, chyepoh omelette and raw cockles served with special chilli dip remains.

5.text: Nestled in the cozy enclave of Tanglin, Patara Fine Thai in Singapore exudes the easy elegance of a world-class restaurant that remains humble despite its achievement in the culinary world. Noted for its classic Thai dishes made from premium ingredients, the restaurant stays relevant in changing times by constantly innovating to fit diners' evolving tastes without straying too far from the heart and soul of the original dishes. And this is one of the reasons why Patara Fine Thai has stood strong for 18 years and counting, in the demanding world of fine dining. The story of Patara Fine Thai's success is about the restaurant's belief in simplicity, and in delivering food, service and ambience of the highest quality. The team takes pride in sharing what it has learned over the years in fine Thai dining with the discerning gourmand. Ultimately, what Patara Fine Thai is sharing, is Thailand at its best.

5.text: Founded in 1995 by Michel Hadley, Michelangelo's remains one of Singapore's premier dining destinations boasting equal measures of exceptional quality and service in Italian cuisine. Ambience, personal attention, and great service melded with an innovative menu are the cornerstones of this iconic restaurant. Presenting an intriguing mix of client favorites, Italian classics and an offering of custom designed meals created daily makes for an irresistible experience. Since its opening, Michelangelo's prides itself with a menu inspired by the feedback of dedicated patrons. Every guest is greeted and served by enthusiastic and dedicated servers with their culinary desires carefully considered by the restaurant's Culinary team. As true icons in Singapore's dining history, Michelangelo's has been the recipient of both internationally acclaimed and prestigious dining industry awards. They carry a comprehensive internationally acclaimed wine list. Perennially listed in Singapore Tatler's and Wine and Dine Magazines' Top 100 Restaurant, Michelangelo's is well-known for their careful detail in wine selections combined with exceptional service. Michelangelo's has also been internationally recognized by Wine Spectator magazine and the recipient of its "Award of Excellence" since 1996

name.name: El Patio Mexican Restaurant & Wine Bar

5.text:
About us
welcome to el patio mexican restaurant wine bar! Established in the year 1985, El Patio, formerly known as El Felipe's Cantina, continues to serve delectable authentic Mexican and Tex-Mex
cooking in a stylish space and festive atmosphere. El Patio is your fun, festive and casual Mexican restaurant that has always been known for
a relaxed dining experience, with warm gracious service where every guest is made to feel welcome and at home. All of our dishes remain faithful to their traditional roots while
incorporating local taste buds. We are committed to purveying great food with the freshest ingredients- for example our salsas  and guacamole are made freshly on site throughout the day! At El Patio, you can also experience and explore the fascinating world of wine, with over 60 carefully curated wine selections. Feel free to come down and pay a visit to our cosy wine room.

5.text: was the birth year of Grimbergen. Introducing Blanche, Blonde and Ambree on taps. As a nod to its chill atmosphere, 1128 also offers an outdoor font where customers -- after ordering their Grimbergen beer -- can try tapping it with guidance from the staff. Offering guests a seamless indoor to outdoor experience whereby folding doors along the bar counter lead to a lush al fresco setting, 1128 is a sanctuary for the urbanite. Vodka aficionados can also indulge in innovative cocktails, mixed with Absolut Elyx, at the outdoor eponymous Elyx vodka bar counter. Pet lovers may be pleased to know that this casual hangout has thoughtfully set up special water troughs by the side of the outdoor bar area for their canine companions. Open from 4pm till 1am. Closed on Mondays. Located at Tanglin Post Office. About Imaginings Pte Ltd ... The management company that brings to you Wala Wala Cafe Bar, KPO and Balaclava. Now the latest addition Nassim Hill & 1128.

5.text: Hot Stones Steak and Seafood Restaurant features a unique dining concept that involves cooking fresh meats and seafood on serpentine volcanic stone slabs. This method seals in the natural juices of the food, providing extraordinary flavour and taste. The restaurant prides itself for giving diners an unforgettable experience by letting the freshness of its produce do the talking. Let your senses be blown away by its premium meats, which the restaurant has so painstakingly sourced and imported directly from one of the most renowned and reputable premium meat suppliers in the United States. And diners will definitely be spoilt for choice as the menu features a comprehensive list of chicken, pork, beef, lamb, fish, seafood and vegetables. Specialties include its Wagyu Beef Selection and Kurobuta Pork, also known as the Berkshire Black Pig.

5.text: CoCo Ichibanya is the famous curry house from Japan with 30 years experience in Japanese food business. It boasts varieties of Japanese Curry with unique and creative style along with the best quality ingredient to make tasty curry. Diners can choose their rice portion, either less or more, and even the spiciness of the curry! The expertise of  CoCo Ichibanya in creating Japanese curry is widely accepted in Japan and other countries thus leading to its great success for the title "The King of Japanese Curry. " Moreover, CoCo Ichibanya is also the largest curry chain in the world in term of the number of branches. There are about 1,268 branches around the world in countries such as US, Japan, China, Taiwan, South Korea, Hong Kong and Thailand.

5.text: A bar that serves real food by real people, that's what Outpost is. Outpost 903 Gastrobar is inspired by the portmanteau culture of gastropubs in the UK, serving quality grub in a cozy bar where people connect. It's a place for friends and families to eat, drink and be merry; a station away from the main forces in the city. Outpost offers a good combination of old-fashion American and British bar menu classics with a Peranakan twist in some. Accompanying its food is the wide spread of beers  and a long list of bottles, wines and many more. Food is served till late so no one goes home hungry.

5.text:
Singapore Food trail is a unique 1960s themed food street in Singapore and an exciting dining attraction, which will bring back fond memories of the good old days. Be transported back to a bygone era, to a time when we savoured popular local delights along the road side from the makeshift carts and stalls. You can reminisce about those carefree good old days while experiencing trhe rich flavour of singapore's well-known local dishes such as hill street tai wah pork noodle, boon tat street barbeque seafood, alhambra satay club satay and old-time favourites like ice balls and kachang puteh. So walk down the memory lane to Singapore 1960s with us now! Free shuttle bus service to singapore food trail
pick-up locations: 
one raffles link entrance  
millenia walk / marina square link bridge bus stop 
millenia tower taxi stand 
centennial tower bus stop 
millenia walk side entrance drop off point) 
conrad centennial bus stop  
timing: 11-45am - 2-30pm, monday - friday 
frequency: about 15mins
free lunch-time parking at singapore flyer during 12pm - 2pm, daily.

5.text: The Cajun Kings is the first of its kind in Singapore, a hearty seafood restaurant catering to the French Acadienne or Cajun palette. In rustic and authentically Creole fashion, partake of our tasty seafood boil with your bare hands and tuck into the mouthwatering flavors of Louisiana in a fun and laid back way. Sample rich, aromatic Creole styles in our menu's garlic butter and lemon pepper variations or choose a comfortable Cajun spice level to suit your individual taste buds. Live seafood highlights include fresh crab, lobsters, prawns and a seasonal variety of sweet ocean pickings. Pair off your sumptuous meal with a choice selection of internationally-sourced craft beers including Schneider-Weisse and Hitachino or the delectable German Weltenburger Kloster on tap. Our restaurant is located in the cosy cluster of Jalan Riang at the heart of Upper Serangoon's thriving residential area, setting the perfect vibe for enjoying fun times with great company. Like Mardi Gras revellers would say, "Laissez les bons temps rouler"... that is, let the good times roll!

5.text:
Here, at SERENITY we bring you the most authentic Spanish flavors and culture - delicious cuisine, flavorful Sangrias, fantastic drinks, great Spanish wines, charming ambience, Spanish live music, Spanish Flamenco performance and attentive friendly service. Some must-tries at Serenity are of course the delectable Authentic Spanish Tapas & Soups, Spanish Rice  Dishes, Spanish Noodle  Dishes, Cochinillo - the Spanish style suckling pig and Sangrias  which are highlights and the signatures of the restaurant. The Signatures at Serenity are delectable Paella Dishes, Spanish Suckling Pig and Spanish Noodle Dishes. Spanish Rice Dishes - Paellas and Spanish Noodle Dishes - Fideuas are made a la minute to ensure the freshness and the perfect taste. More than 8 types of Paella and Fideua dishes to choose such as Seafood Paella, Vegetarian Paella, Valencian Paella and Pork Ribs Paella.... The Signature Suckling Pig prepared the Spanish way, will delight with its crispy golden skin and tender juicy meat accentuated by selected Spanish wines, herbs and spices. While waiting for Spanish Suckling Pig and Paella to arrive, order some Tapas, Soup or Salad. A jug of Sangria or Spanish wine definitely complements the meal. Serenity's signature spanish suckling pig is now available all day for dine in & takeaway

5.text: Violet Oon made her name as a food columnist in the late 1980s and was later appointed a food ambassador by the Singapore Tourism Board. Her work has led to appearances on local and foreign television programs and she is also the author of three cookbooks. Throughout all her years of travel and living abroad, Violet's culinary passion has unabashedly remained with Singapore. As such, she has brought home the spoils of cuisines discovered abroad and married those gems with her beloved native Singaporean cuisine. Violet Oon's Kitchen is a local bistro with a twist. The menu includes her signature Nyonya fare, Shepherds Pie and interpretations of much loved Singapore favorites that she would serve at her own table. The bistro also offers a delectable variety of refreshing drinks and alcoholic beverages that have been carefully selected and curated to match the menu, including a unique Guava smoothie and Peanut Butter Milkshake with Reese's pieces.

5.text: Traditional and yet with a contemporary pulse - paulaner wirsthaus clarke quay is a location at which time-honored bavarian traditions are combined with a modern appreciation of life in a distinctive way. A genuine brand concept, which very successfully shifts the renown Munich Paulaner beer into the center of sophisticated hospitality and attracts locals just as much as travelers and visitors from Germany and abroad. It offers a unique mixture of bar, pub, restaurant, lounge, event location and beer garden, beneath one roof. The ambiance and atmosphere are casual, yet stylish. Locals as well as visitors sit together at long tables, say cheers to each other and enjoy their "outing to Bavaria". The food selection consists of three pillars: Classics of the Bavarian cuisine , which are prepared and served authentically, as well as internationally popular dishes and current food trends. Of course all dishes correspond magnificently with the Paulaner beer specialties. At the paulaner singapore clarke quay, centuries - old traditions are given a contemporary interpretation and an unconventional blend. This aspiration applies to the entire concept -- from the furnishing and equipment to the food selection, all the way to the fondly created atmosphere.

5.text: Restoran ZZ. 20B Jalan Sungai Chat  It is at the end of this road, and just before the start of Jalan Mahmoodiah, behind the Sultanah Aminah Hospital, only 200m east of the Thistle Hotel. Popular low-key eatery serving Malay and Thai dishes, with a total of 60 items on its menu. Prices of selected dishes - breakfast : roti kosong 0-80 rm, roti john 2-50 rm, mee or nasi goreng with telur 2-50 rm, laksa johor penang 3-50 rm, murtabak 4 rm, nasi lemak 2-50 or 4 rm, lontong 2-50 or 4 rm; lunch : nasi ayam 3-50 rm, ikan bakar 4 to 8 rm, nasi briyani ayam 5-50 rm, nasi briyani daging 5-50 rm, nasi briyani kambing 7 rm, ayam penyet 6-50 rm; dinner : mee bandung 4 rm, nasi lemak kukus 4 rm, mee wantan 4 rm, mee tomyam 4 rm, ikan bakar 5 rm, nasi beriani gam kambing 7 rm; all meals: nasi daging 4 rm;  black coffee or tea 1 rm, coffee or tea with milk 1-20 rm, air buah 2-50 rm. Besides ordering full-plate or full-bowl dishes , you can also get servings from the more than 20 dishes on the buffet counters  - you will be charged accordingly for each of these servings. There is no government tax or service charge. No air-con, seating capacity for about 100 persons. Open daily .

you can find us at "hungrygowhere. Drinking tea is Japanese's culture; however people are so attracted to drinking coffee rather than tea. He became worried that the habit of drinking tea will be taken over by coffee. This inspired him to open the first Nana's green tea in Jiyugaoka that is famously known in Japan throughout the years. It is based on green tea that was famously originated from Japan which has many benefits to our body, and well known for its cancer-fighting properties. After that, it expanded its business overseas to countries such as Shanghai, Hong Kong and also Singapore. Mission: 
To advocate Japanese tea and food to people around the world. Vision: 
To expand and enrich people with Japanese food culture. Goals: 
To allow people to experience Japanese food and at the same time being able to enrich them with Japanese culture and traditional food. Provide high quality of service to customers; let people enjoy superior dining experiences here in Nana's green tea.

5.text: Tucked away in a cozy corner of the Shaw Foundation Alumni House along Kent Ridge Drive, Late Plate is touted as one of the under-the-radar bistros to watch out for this year. Australian Chef Roland Graham helms the kitchen with an impressive track record of over 35 years of culinary experience spanning Singapore, Bangkok, New York and Doha. Trained in the 5-star sheraton hotel sydney, chef roland counts amongst his many achievements positions as head chef of "the australian " in manhattan, new york, and executive chef of sareeraya koh samui and a prominent dining establishment in singapore. His long-awaited return to Singapore has created a buzz in the local food industry and media. Chef Roland promises a radical take on the all-day breakfast concept and an original approach to the modern bistro with a distinctly Asian-inspired twist. No effort has been spared in the selection of choice ingredients for the freshest and highest quality. Fans of Chef Roland will be able to recognise his signature style as he brings fresh and surprising flavours to classic breakfast dishes. Understated décor and raw furnishing make the bistro an inviting hangout amidst the whirl of campus activity. Late Plate offers the charm of a laid-back dining experience that packs a punch with its contemporary and creative menu offerings.

5.text: Moving from France, Hong Kong, and finally to Singapore, our very own locally bred chef Paul Then now offers us a delightful shift of paradigm in Asian cuisine! With his wide exposure of different traditional foods, he now presents his dishes with the best ingredients from all over the world. Whether you're looking for traditional Asian food or a surprising new twist, Noodle 8 gives you a wide variety of fresh, handmade noodles, originating from all parts of Asia. Noodle 8 also boasts creative craftsmanship in desserts such as the Durian Alaska, green tea tiramisu, and papaya noodles. Walking into Noodle 8 brings you into a whole new Asia - where east meets west, old meets new, and where we create innovation from tradition.

Dine to the first Baja Fresh outlet in Asia!!. Baja Fresh offers consistently fresh and flavorful Mexican food for lunch, dinner, dine-in, catering or take-out served in a friendly and upbeat environment. What can be a better meal than delicious Mexican food with a chilled bottle of beer or ice cold margaritas. So come along and bring your friends at our flagship outlet in Singapore Baja Fresh @ Bras Basah.

At Table Manners, we are always gracious, sometimes irreverent. It begins right in this sitting spot, as you ponder over this morning's carb-counter. We offer you the freedom to build your very own platter from our selection of good, old comfort European fare. With coffee by Papa Palheta, tea from Tea Forte and designer cocktails by Bar Stories, get teased by the variety of choices offered. Indulge yourselves further with our range of classy tableware, perky napkins and cheery dining furniture. Get to know us inside-out and your cutlery outside-in, and spread the word. For greater gastronomic good,
The Table Manners Team

At Five & Dime, we don't rely on pretenses. Our philosophy is simple and honest: we're all about wholesome, belly-warming comfort food in a friendly and cozy atmosphere. Good food, good drinks and good company. Weekends are for brunch! Join us for an Eggs Benny or the ultimate hangover curing Corned Beef Hash. Available on Saturdays and Sundays from 10:00 am to 15:00 pm.
Aburi Sushi and Cocktail Nights coming soon! Stay tuned for more information. We'd love for you to join us! Free parking around the back of the compound. It's nice to dine at the Five & Dime!
