5.text: At this Australian-inspired restaurant and bar, what you can expect is 'outback meets chic'. The key feature and highlight of the Barossa is the Long Bar where you can mingle with your buddies or BFFs, and enjoy a range of craft beers by Archipelago Brewery. The bar also boasts a range of new world wines and champagnes, and there's no shortage of your favourite shooters, Martinis and Mojitos. Its unpretentious, laid-back and rustic ambience makes it the perfect place to chill out after a hard day's work and tuck in hearty fusion Australian fare created only with the freshest Australian seafood and premium grades of Australian beef. Signature dishes such as beer battered fish & chips, bbq berry ribs, char grilled rib eye, beef ragout pasta, barossa salad & wild mushroom pizza is a must try @ barossa.

5.text: Inspired by the indie cafes in Japan. L'etoile is a lifestyle shop cum cafe with Japanese-French influences. Located in the heart of Novena/ Farrer Park area, it offers an off the beaten track venue for a quiet afternoon to be spent over drinking coffee and reading good books. Come evening when the sun has set, relax with a glass of wine amidst a surrounding of either simple clean cut furniture on the first floor, or an eclectic interior on the second floor. Brunch is served till 4pm on weekend evenings, you can be expected to be served exclusively by the chef during private dinner events.

5.text: Sabio, the Spanish Tapas place, is the latest "it" bar in the up-and-coming regenerated heritage area of Duxton Hill. The bar's dynamic space fuses traditional Spanish references with contemporary features. It's a subtle balance that creates an atmosphere with the comfort of a familiar haunt and the energy of a hip urban bar. Complementing the setting is a tapas menu that uses imported and fresh seasonal produce alongside an extensive range of boutique wines, beers and spirits. With each visit you'll be greeted with a brand new experience thanks to the ever-changing array of specially sourced treats on offer.

5.text: Located below the Flower Dome at Gardens by the Bay, the newly opened Majestic Bay Seafood Restaurant is inspired by the luxurious waterfront views of Marina Bay. The menu showcases some of the city's favourite classics like chilli crab, black pepper crab, steamed fish, and other chinese dishes like roast meats and peking duck, along with innovative new creations by renowned chef yong bing ngen. The Bay's signature "Kopi" Crab is a must-try and the Baked Rice with Seafood in Chef's Recipe Sauce is a delightful dish, perfect for any occasion. With a seating capacity of 110 in the main dining hall, Majestic Bay Seafood Restaurant is a wonderful dining option for gathering with family and friends. A private dining room which hosts up to 14 guests is also available for booking.

5.text:
Parco Caffè is nestled in idyllic Raeburn Park, behind the former Tanjong Pagar railway station  . Brought to you by the very same team behind Spruce and Alkaff Mansion Ristorante, Parco Caffè is set to be the next off-the-beaten-track dining destination and a refreshing new location for private or corporate events. Escape and unwind in a place where the serenity of lush greenery is infused with affordable good food at the fringe of the Central Business District. 'Parco'  is the central theme of the restaurant and the park has been brought into the dining experience, with the restaurant featuring verdant green foliage and three indoor al-fresco areas, allowing guests to enjoy an "outdoor" experience in indoor comfort. Savoring a meal in our glass-roofed central courtyard is reminiscent of dining in a garden on a gorgeous sunny day. Complementing the luxuriant garden setting is the extensive menu, offering both classic Italian cuisine and authentic Asian gastronomy to offer the perfect balance of east-meets-west. A full bar and wine selection completes the dining experience for those who want to pair their food with a choice beverage. Being a stone's throw away from the CBD also makes Parco Caffè the perfect spot for lunches and dinners with business associates, and a haven for winding down with drinks from the unique selection of reasonably priced fine wines and apéritifs after a long day's work. Free wifi allows guests to work or surf at ease while enjoying the serenity of Parco Caffè. During Public Holidays, Parco Caffè opens from 09-00 til 23-00
Complimentary Car Parking available

5.text: It's alright, you didn't know any better. The days of cheap and tasteless dregs of insta-coffee are over. Let us introduce you to a world of real, honest-to-goodness, mmm-i'm-loving-it COFFEE. In this short but insightful induction to this exclusive world of brew-lovers, we'll have to talk about the coffee bean - the source of all things brilliant about a steaming cup of delicious brown nirvana. Sip your brew, and bask in the nuttiness that Brazilian-born beans offer. Hints of spiciness? That's the work of Asia-Pacific beans. For a little fruitiness and acidic tang, look to Africa, where beans are harvested at dizzying altitudes along the slopes of Mount Kenya. So the next time you're waxing lyrical about your next cup of joe in here at The Broers Cafe, make up a a story about this guru of beans you met somewhere exotic like Tibet, or anywhere but this cheat-sheet of a poster. Oh and by the way, you're welcome.

A good polish, wood restoration, reupholstery, we do whatever it takes to bring back the former glory of a piece of old furniture. We only take in quality pieces, those that are made of good wood, for example, and give them a new life with gorgeous new upholstery and the results are usually amazing! Whether you have a vintage theme for your home or just want to inject a bit of character to a room with a few vintage accents, you may just find what you're looking for at Restore.

5.text: As a young and vibrant F&B company founded in May 2007, Olive Vine offers a decent selection of pasta and western fusion cuisine, local specialties, as well as sandwiches and cakes. It aims to position its brand as the best tasting and affordable pasta and western food available in the F&B sector in Singapore. In addition, Olive Vine values and promotes healthy eating and hence its dishes are served without any MSG added. Olive Vine's initial ventures began in food court outlets located at Bugis Junction, Great World City, and Raffles City. With its healthy progress, Olive Vine established its very first full outlet at Marina Square in November 2010. Today, Olive Vine has successfully evolved and is piloting three full outlets located at Marina Square , Suntec City Mall  and 470 North Bridge Road  respectively. Olive Vine's strong reserve in serving quality dining is highly commended and their professional standards are recognized within the industry -- Olive Vine has thus far received the 2011 Singapore Brand Award and 2011 Young Entrepreneurship Award  respectively.

5.text: This BBQ steamboat restaurant  opened on 1 Jan, 2010 and is 1-1km or about 10 minutes' walk northwest of the Thistle Hotel, 100m south of the Kolam Ayer Mosque. It only serves all-you-can-eat BBQ steamboat buffet meals for 20-90/9-90 RM net . Outdoor and indoor  seating are both available. The steamboat menu  includes - seafood like baby crab, fish, prawns, clams, fish balls; meat - meat balls, sausages, slices of chicken and beef, chicken eggs; others - tofu, yong tau foo, green leafy vegetables, noodles. Besides, you can help yourself to unlimited servings of cooked white rice, porridge, cold drinks and cut fruits. 1 free ice-cream stick per diner. Halal; Open daily 5pm to 12 midnite.

5.text: Housed in one of Singapore's trendiest heritage districts, La Maison Fatien Singapour extends the tradition, warmth and welcome of its namesake in Burgundy. The four storey, pre-war conservation house is typical of Singaporean architecture at the turn of the century, with its distinctive five-foot walkway entrance, Peranakan-styled windows, and central airwell. Restored and converted, La Maison Fatien Singapour promises to be a perfect blend of classic French bistro in Asia's true melting pot and gateway. Spanning three of four storeys, the first and second levels of the restaurant allow 60 guests to dine in the comforts of home while the fourth level is a multi-function space for private and corporate events.

5.text: Originating from Lock Road at Gillman Village The Villa Bali has bought in its joglos, lesehans and other Balinese paraphernalia. Affectionately known as Little Bali, we left behind our iconic Majapahid Gate, a legacy of the tragic bombing of Bali on 12 October 2002. Our Mission -- Providing a dining and entertainment experience that allows people to commune with nature, relax, de-stress and be happy. By bringing nature and the Bali culture of service into the living or dining space our guests can experience the ultimate environment to chill-out, dine and entertain their friends and family.

5.text:
Coffee, hot meals... all favourites! Piping hot fresh brewed local coffee. Or what us locals call "kopi". Think about it... thinly sliced light brown bread toast with thick wads of creamy butter melting on kaya jam. Dipping this lip-smacking goodness into a saucer of soft-boiled eggs is well... close to a great start to another day at the office!! Then there is lunch. 4 kinds of horfun, 3 of them our Chef Jeannie's very own concoction. 3 kinds of Chinese fried rice, 2 of them again Chef Jeannie's special creation. All cooked with heart... that unmistakable "wok-hei" charred aroma of Cantonese cooking! Now don't get us started on the Ampang Yong Tau Fu, the Shang Mien... What about all that rave about bubble tea? Heard of the SFD Anything Special BBT? It simply has E-V-E-R-Y-T-H-I-N-G! Always the one to go for if you can't decide what flavour to choose from our menu of close to 15 BBT! Then there are the Oreo biscuit specials... Kopi Oreo BBT? Always a crowd pleaser. Can't have a clue what all the yummy food and drinks look like? Even when you're at the cafe and still can't visualise what all the dishes' names mean... there are ring binders of our food menu just to start your mouth watering...
Hey! What are you still waiting for? For the locals, there's a local saying... "mai tu liao!". See you soon!

5.text: Founded in 1997, singaporeâs award-winning microbrewery restaurant, brewerkz restaurant & microbrewery, was the brain-child of us-born devin otto kimble and daniel flores, who initially modeled it after similar concepts in the usa and canada. The iconic full-service restaurant features high quality American-style food and a full range of premium beers handcrafted on-site from the 10 hl microbrewery attached to the restaurant. Most notable attraction of the restaurant is the distinctly featured custom-made microbrewery built by Newlands Systems Inc in Abbotsford, BC Canada. Equipped with specially fabricated fermentation tanks that have been designed to minimize floor-space needs, the brewing system produces over 2,500 hectoliters of beer per annum, nearly all of which is drunk at both Brewerkz locations and their sister concepts CafÃ Iguana and WineGarage. The restaurant side of Brewerkz is headed by General Manager & Executive Chef, Dan Durkin, who hails from the cheese capital of the USA, Wisconsin. Durkin, who came to Brewerkz from the highly acclaimed Zenith Restaurant in Denver, focuses on offering all-American cuisine with an emphasis on regional dishes from the Deep South, the Southwest and California.

5.text: Singapore's supreme discount department store: floor after floor of absolutely everything at rock-bottom prices, ranging from Rolex watches and washing machines to fresh mangoes, bags of lentils, tailored suits and airline tickets. Open 24 hours; the exchange counters in front are probably the best place in Singapore to exchange any currency you can think of  at competitive rates. Mustafa Centre also offers travel, hotel reservation and visa assistance services. Note: There are now many mini-Mustafa outlets scattered along Serangoon Rd, but the original and by far the largest is the one facing Syed Alwi Rd.

Ksl city, sandwiched between jalan seladang, jalan kijang, jalan serigala and jalan beruang in taman centuri, 500 m west of the jalan dato' sulaiman/tebrau highway junction. Opened in Dec 2010, this 4-storey shopping mall that is part of a shopping-residential-hotel complex is the biggest in the city. It hs 350 sales outlets, including 70 food and beverage outlets and a eight-screen cineplex. It is open daily from 10AM-10PM. A metered taxi from City Square at Jl Wong Ah Fook to here costs about RM4 , and there are many buses  that go past the Jalan Datok Sulaiman/Tebrau Highway junction. Maju bus number IM17  travels between Holiday Plaza  and City Square, passing by KSL City. Causeway link s1 bus  travels between city square and ksl city every 20 min in both directions from 8:30am-11pm, with decreasing frequencies from 8-30am-10am and 8am-11pm.

Tiong Bahru Plaza offers a unique urban experience, being part of the city downtown area. The mall is constantly re-inventing itself, to present new and exciting offerings to its shoppers. Spread over 7 retail floors, its lettable area of 190,000 square feet houses 165 shops and 3 floors of basement car park.

Nestled in the highly coveted Somerset area along Orchard Road, 313@somerset addresses Singaporeans' passion for fashion with a wide range of choices for both male and female patrons. Offering the very best in mid-level fashion offerings, it features 8 levels of retail and food outlets and caters to the youthful and trendy fashionista. This leading fashion mall spans a variety of leading global and local brands like Zara, Uniqlo, Forever 21, New Look, Cotton On and Esprit. It is complemented by lifestyle anchor retailers stadium by rsh, hmv and cold storage specialty, and the unique thematic discovery walk outdoor dining precinct featuring a cluster of crowd pullers brotzeit german bier bar and restaurant, marché restaurant and natural bakery, malones irish restaurant & bar, jibiru japanese craft beer bar and many more. 313@somerset is flanked by generous transport options: conveniently accessible via the Mass Rapid Transit  -- direct entry and exit point to Somerset MRT at Basement 2 -- major bus stops, and pedestrian routes linking Somerset Road to Orchard Road. The mall features 8 levels of shopping & dining - 5 above and 3 below ground, and 2 floors of car parking on Levels 6 & 7.
Like' our page to get updates on exciting happenings, promotions, eco fun and more!

Marina Square  is a shopping mall in Singapore which opened in the late 1980s. It is part of the first building complex built on the reclaimed land at Marina Centre, and was the largest shopping mall in the country at the time. The complex also houses three hotels, which are Mandarin Oriental Singapore, Marina Mandarin and the Pan Pacific Singapore.

TokoMu Apparels
A collection of the globe's  trendiest and hippest wear. We firmly believe that cool streetwear should never be out of anyone's reach , we bring to you unknown to well known labels from all over the globe and constantly add new brands and labels to our collection . We strive to price most of our items affordable to everyone, without sacrifing quality and style . TokoMu Salvage
Salvage is the used goods division of TokoMu. Through our online trading and dealers we are able to sell and also source used goods at the right value. Salvage is also another way for TokoMu and fellow TokoMuans to give back to the environment by recycling. One man's junk is another man's treasure ! Junk or treasure, let us decide!

The Centrepoint is a popular shopping destination with both local shoppers and visitors from abroad. Located prominently at Orchard Road, The Centrepoint features a good mix of well-known retailers and a wide choice of quality merchandise. Anchor tenants are Cold Storage, Marks & Spencer and Robinsons. The Centrepoint won a Silver in the Orchard Road Best Dressed Building orgainsed by Orchard Road Business Association in 2009. It set a new Singapore record for Tallest Christmas Tree Made of Cupcakes  on 13 November 2009 and Tallest Chocolate Sculpture  on 2 December 2008.
We sell Philippines food and other grocery items  and others more.

About tangs
recognised as one of singapore's iconic shopping destinations, tangs is a leading player in the retail industry; constantly keeping their fingers on the pulse of the changing consumer needs and trends. With the tangs transformation and the launch of the new tangs beauty and seviin at tangs, singapore's most iconic store will raise the bar for the retail industry as tangs steps up its role as a curator of brands, redefining the department store concept as we know it. today, tangs has two stores in singapore -- tangs orchard and tangs vivocity, as well as three stores in kuala lumpur, malaysia -- tangs 1 utama, tangs empire subang and tangs genting. We welcome your thoughts and contributions, as well as the give-and-take that flows from a conversation among different people with different opinions. We request all users to remain respectful of the other members of our community.

Art Plural Gallery is a unique 12,000 sqft space dedicated to Modern, Contemporary Art and Design, in the heart of Singapore's cultural district. Founded by Swiss art dealer Frédéric de Senarclens, this innovative platform nestled in a four-storey Art Deco heritage monument presents solo and group exhibitions, installations, public art projects, conferences, and art publications. Art Plural Gallery is open to the public.

Plaza Kotaraya, Jalan Trus, only 500 m from the CIQ. It is smaller and older than the nearby City Square. Its main tenant, the UO Superstore,  has a wide range of groceries, household appliances, clothes, toys, luggage at competitive prices. There are several restaurants and a food court. Open daily 10AM-10PM. The entire shopping centre has been closed for renovation since the last quarter of 2011.

Harvey Norman from Australia, is a leading household name in Singapore. A retail chain in Electronics, Computers, Furniture and Bedding, Harvey Norman in Singapore is operating under Pertama Merchandising Pte Ltd which is fully owned by Pertama Holdings Limited. Harvey Norman has a prominent international presence with over 264 stores in Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, Slovenia and Malaysia.

We offer a great selection of books ranging from topics such as Spiritual & Philosophy to Health and Well Being to Management & Accounting to Engineering & Technology etc..  If you are a lover of Vintage books, we have a large collection of used books as well. All at a bargain price.... you will not believe it.

Kallang Tennis Centre is situated at the south-eastern region of Singapore. It is adjacent to the Kallang Field, and is part of the Kallang Sports Centre. It is located just outside the central business district area.
Hougang Mall , previously known as NTUC Hougang Mall, is a suburban shopping mall located in Hougang, Singapore. It is located near Hougang Central Bus Interchange, as well as Hougang.
Visit our Farmers' Market, happening every first Saturday and Sunday of each month, happening from 9am to 2pm!
City Plaza, Singapore, located near Paya Lebar MRT. A local shopping centre near Malay Cultural District, Gaylang Serai, Katong Shopping Mall. Minutes to East Coast Park, Marina Bay.

Orchard Towers is a 18-story office building in Singapore located on the corner of Claymore Road and Orchard Road. Construction was completed in 1975. The first five floors are a combination of bars and retail outlets with the remainder leased as offices. During the day the building functions as a retail and office style building, but the building is best known as a landmark entertainment complex famously described as the "Four Floors of Whores" or simply the "Four Floors". In addition, one of the towers houses 58 freehold condominium residential units.

FOX Women and FOX Men offer the latest must-haves for the young, expressive and style-conscious. With collections that are always edgy and trendy, get set to reinvent your street style and stand out with your individuality. Little ones can have their fashion fix too, with FOX Kids and Baby bringing its signature casual look to newborns and children up to 12 years of age.

Thirsty is the premier retailer of specialty beers and premium ciders in Singapore. Offering the largest beer and cider selection from around the world with over 400 different types, we specialize in unique and fine brews imported from over 20 countries. Our products are carefully hand-crafted for taste and quality, by brewers who share our passion and appreciation for excellent beers and ciders. Committed to be the one-stop shop for unique beer experiences and discovery, we continue to update our collection to bring in the world's best beers to Singapore. Thirsty also provides the convenience of beer delivery services through our online shop for anyone to enjoy a delicious, thirst-quenching pint at the comfort of home.

Space and parking lots are hard to come by in Singapore. But not at The Grandstand -- the former Turf Club that used to house avid horse racing spectators; lately, it's the avid shoppers and diners who are drawn into this newly transformed family lifestyle destination. Following a fresh facelift, The Grandstand is set to reinvent the Singapore lifestyle experience, completely surrounded by nature. This 1 million square feet property is home to an eclectic mix of retailers, dining and services outlets, kids' activities clusters, and one of the biggest pre-owned car mall. The North Grandstand comprises 7 levels while the South Grandstand comprises 6 levels. Regardless of which side you're at, both are dedicated to accommodate everyone's needs on every level. If you're looking to shop, dine or simply sit back and relax, here is a refreshing place where you can spend quality time with family, friends and colleagues.
Upscale mall known for housing Singapore's best collection of luxury watch retailers.

Located within the Bedok Town Centre, Bedok Point is a redevelopment of both the former Bedok and Changi Theatres. The mall is 4-storey high with 2 basements. It will be the first mall in Bedok and will provide an exciting array of F&B, entertainment, retail and service offerings all under one roof. Major tenants include Challenger, Du Yi Bookshop, Japan Home, K Box Karaoke and TZ-Active. Home to many restaurants, the mall will be an ideal dining venue with its wide offerings of different cuisines. Besides popular restaurants such as paradise inn, sushi tei and the manhattan fish market, the mall also offers specialty restaurants and cafes such as ayam penyet ria, bishamon sapporo ramen, hong kong sun kee dessert and nydc. For the fastfood lovers, there is also MOS Burger, Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen and Subway. The supper goers will also be pleased to know that the F&B restaurants and cafes at Level 1 of the mall are open till 1 am on weekdays and 3 am on weekends. Nursery rooms with hot water dispenser facility and kiddy toilets are located at all levels. Shoppers can enjoy free Wi-Fi access with Wireless@SG

Causeway Point is located in the heart of Woodlands Regional Centre in Singapore, next to the Woodlands MRT station and bus interchange. With more than 250 shops, it is the largest mall in the Frasers Centrepoint Malls group.

Plaza Singapura is a contemporary shopping mall located along Orchard Road, Singapore. The mall is managed by CapitaLand and owned by CapitaMall Trust. There are retail outlets over seven floors and two basements. The mall has a 752 lot seven storey carpark at the rear of the building, and a two basement goods bay beneath it. Anchor tenants include Carrefour, Golden Village, John Little, Marks & Spencer, Best Denki, Spotlight and Yamaha. The mall is popular with families, teenagers and young adults.

Parkway Parade is one of Singapore's first major and biggest suburban malls. It is the destination of choice, offering the largest range of stores on the east coast of singapore
with over 250 stores conveniently located over 6 levels including best denki, cold storage, cotton on, esprit, giant hypermarket, harvey norman, isetan, marks & spencer, treats, true fitness and timezone just to name a few, you're sure to find everything you need.

Thomson Plaza is a suburban shopping centre under MCST, located in the heart of private & public residential estates at Upper Thomson Road. Many popular brands can be found in thomson plaza, such as fairprice finest, yamaha music school, amore fitness & boutique spa, popular book store, sushi tei, swensen's, paradise inn, kfc, pizza hut, starbucks, kopitiam and many more. The carpark has a total of 413 lots and 3 handicapped parking lots. Free valet parking is available during lunch time on weekdays and all day on weekends and public holidays.

FOX Women and FOX Men offer the latest must-haves for the young, expressive and style-conscious. With collections that are always edgy and trendy, get set to reinvent your street style and stand out with your individuality. Little ones can have their fashion fix too, with FOX Kids and Baby bringing its signature casual look to newborns and children up to 12 years of age.

AMK Hub is a suburban shopping mall located in Ang Mo Kio, within the North-East Region of Singapore. It has the air-conditioned Ang Mo Kio Bus Interchange, the third bus interchange in Singapore to be fully air-conditioned, which is linked to Ang Mo Kio via an underpass. The shopping mall has 48,250 square metres of gross floor area and of retail space.
Far East Plaza is a shopping centre in Singapore, located in the heart of the Orchard Road shopping belt. It opened in 1982 together with a Metro  that has since closed down.

The Clementi Mall is a six-storey retail development totaling approximately 191,000 square feet of retail space, which includes a basement shopping level and a basement carpark. With its strategic location in Clementi town and accessibility to integrated transport amenities like the Clementi MRT station and bus interchange, The Clementi Mall is poised to be an anchor attraction in the area. Positioned as a contemporary and mid-market mall, the clementi mall will enjoy a good catchment from holland village, bukit timah and west coast, where key tertiary institutions such as national university of singapore, ngee ann polytechnic, singapore polytechnic, and unisim are located.

Liang Court offers a unique "Asia Fusion by the River" shopping experience and attracts overseas visitors, expatriates and locals from the residential condominiums in the vicinity and office workers from the nearby Central Business District. The mall is part of a mixed development comprising a 326 room Novotel Clarke Quay Hotel and a 26 storey serviced apartment, Somerset Residences.

FOX Women and FOX Men offer the latest must-haves for the young, expressive and style-conscious. With collections that are always edgy and trendy, get set to reinvent your street style and stand out with your individuality. Little ones can have their fashion fix too, with FOX Kids and Baby bringing its signature casual look to newborns and children up to 12 years of age.
Lucky Plaza is a shopping centre located at Orchard Road in Singapore.

Junction 8 is a popular heartland shopping mall located in the centre of Bishan New Town. It is located outside Bishan and Bishan Bus Interchange. Escalators were also installed to offer shoppers more convenience. The name of this shopping centre was derived from the old station numbering of the North South Line sector of nearby Bishan .

5.text:
Greetings to all TINTIN fans!!! It is with great pleasure I announce the arrival of a Belgian icon to Singapore: "TINTIN is here in Chinatown!! " 
The most comprehensive array of TINTIN merchandise and the largest TINTIN shop in the world. Furthermore, to complete the Belgian experience, a small beer garden in front of our shop selling purely Belgian beer. So come on down and enjoy a small enclave of Belgium in Sunny Singapore.

Jurong Point Shopping Centre  is a leading suburban retail mall situated in the western part of Singapore. Strategically located next to boon lay mrt station and bus interchange, jurong point serves as the gateway to the jurong west industrial estate, singapore's key educational institutions and the residential population in the west.

name.name: Cape Of Good Hope Art Gallery

address.address: 140 Hill Street 01 06 Old Hill Street Police Station Building

5.text: The Gallery effects  services  related to art  investment such as assisting  art collectors in planning investment. With the advent of technology, the gallery is actively harnessing online technology to enhance communication amongst its clientele of designers, art collectors and art lovers.

Compass Point is situated in the heart of Sengkang and is integrated with the MRT, LRT and the bus interchange. It is Singapore's first thematic suburban mall based on the theme of learning. It also organizes "Fun Ahoy! - Learn Thru' Play and Craft", a monthly kids' programme.
Rochester Mall, stands within the work-live-play-learn environment of One-north community is designed by Japanese famed architect Mr Paul Noritaka Tange of Tange Associates.
Forum The Shopping Mall is a shopping mall located on Singapore's main shopping belt, Orchard Road. It was built on the site of the Singapura Forum Hotel.

5.text: A prominent and sophisticated mall in the heart of Orchard Road, Paragon is the choice destination for up-market shoppers in search of top-notch luxury products and quality services. With six levels of designer fashion and luxury boutiques, sports and lifestyle shops, restaurants and cafes, Paragon offers a complete shopping experience for both tourists and locals.

Whether you are a customer, an associate, an employee, an ex-employee, or simply a communications user, we warmly invite you to join our page to get regularly updated information on the hottest news, promotions and events! You can also find us as "singtelteam" or "singtelteamonline" on all major local forums!

Hours: 11am- 8pm daily

Ngee Ann City is a shopping and commercial centre located on Orchard Road, Singapore. The S$520 million building was officially opened on 21 September 1993 by then Prime Minister, Goh Chok Tong. Many Singaporeans refer to Ngee Ann City as "Taka", a slang-abbreviation of the anchor tenant's name, Takashimaya. In fact, this name is now probably more commonly used in everyday conversation than the building's original name.

address.address: No 9 Yong Siak Street Tiong Bahru

5.text: BooksActually  is an independent bookstore specialising in Literature . In our bookstore, you can often find literary trinkets in the form of stationery and other lovely tchotchkes. We publish and distribute books under our imprint Math Paper Press. We also hand-stitch notebooks and produce stationery under Birds & Co. BooksActually is now housed at No. 9 Yong Siak Street, in the heart of Tiong Bahru. Come, say hello !

Beauty Express International was established in 1988 and is one of Singapore's leading beauty service provider of skincare and body treatments. Beauty Express success hinges on its continued emphasis on quality products and professional services since its establishment in 1988. Keeping up with technological advances requires not only substantial funds but heartfelt dedication and commitment on our part to customers' satisfaction. Our facilities are first grade and the wide array of sophisticated equipment used, are what current technology can offer. Such a tremendous investment in resource and the amount of effort we've put in is the least we can do for our customers who have entrusted us with their lifelong dream of being beautiful. It is a belief that's been much admired by many and our successful track record plus testimonials from satisfied clients places us at where we are to this very day. That is why 22 years on, Beauty Express still is the smart woman's choice.

Golden Mile Complex is a high-rise commercial and residential building on Beach Road in Kallang, Singapore. The building was formerly known as Woh Hup Complex. The complex has 411 shops and 500 parking places.
Fine art gallery specialising in Chinese contemporary art. Also available are works by Asian artist.

Baby Hyperstore is the authorized agent for Quinny, Maclaren, Peg perego, Cybex ,Inglesina and Maxi Cosi in Singapore. It has a 3 level showroom located in the above address. The showroom is big enough for customer's convenience.

Harvey Norman from Australia, is a leading household name in Singapore. A retail chain in Electronics, Computers, Furniture and Bedding, Harvey Norman in Singapore is operating under Pertama Merchandising Pte Ltd which is fully owned by Pertama Holdings Limited. Harvey Norman has a prominent international presence with over 264 stores in Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, Slovenia and Malaysia.

Little Man takes his discoveries and becomes a curator of things. Special things others might overlook. The collection is always evolving: from luxury clothing to art to home accessories and any other well thought out oddity in between.

Simpliciti is the perfect chill out haven for ladies' first love - Shopping! We bring together quirky and unique dresses at wallet friendly prices. Whether it's a dress for work, for play or simply just lounging - you are sure to find something! You can also find accessories, bags and shoes to complete any outfit
Come as a Party of Four and book an exclusive hour during the weekdays just for you and your BFFs to shop to your heart's content! Or simply call or message us before popping by to make an appointment as we may just be out shopping for you. If you are driving, there is ample parking. For non-drivers we are conveniently located next to Anglo-Chinese Junior School, near the Newton MRT and bus-stops within a comfortable 7 minutes walk even on high heels! We accept cash and credit card payments  by Visa or Mastercard although minimum charge amounts will apply

One of the best places to buy electronics in Singapore, stores here are strictly vetted and the risk of getting ripped off is low. To test new purchases, you can even make use of the WiFi facility in the mall to get online and do the necessary checks. Tax Free Shopping for Tourists For tourists visiting Singapore, a Premier Tax Free Refund Voucher is issued with a minimum spend of $100 at any Premier Tax-Free affiliated store. GST refunds will be issued upon departure from Singapore Changi Airport.

Staggering list of beers from around the world, on the expensive side, but cheaper than in the tourist traps of Boat Quay/Clarke Quay. Shows English Premier League football and other major sporting events on a large screen outdoors.

Former power station now hosting no less than 9 clubs and bars with different themes, including Powerhouse for dance pop, Dragonfly for Mandarin/Cantonese live music, Movida for Latin rhythms and Bellini Room for jazz. Popular with Singaporeans and somewhat more downmarket than the options at Clarke Quay. Opening hours and prices vary per club, but most are open Wednesday to Sunday and charge $10-20 for entry .

Debuted in 2011, Mink has taken its cue from the hottest nightclubs in Los Angeles, San Tropez, & Las Vegas with its luxuriously appointed interiors, dance podiums, premium bottle service, and has successfully taken the Singapore nightlife scene by storm by creating the most high energy party atmosphere in town. With a focus on the Las Vegas inspired House/Electro Music sound pioneered by Avicii, The Swedish House Mafia, & Kaskade, Mink has established itself as the premiere venue in town to listen to the best in electronic music, receive attentive, premium bottle service, network with a mature, fun-loving crowd, and most importantly, create unforgettable memories. Mink has brought in a host of world renowned DJs including award winning producers Clinton Sparks  and Jump Smokers . Stay tuned for much, much more in 2012. ENTRY:
Guestlist by invitation and referral only. - cover charge entry $28/1 drink 
cover charge entry $28/3 drinks wednesdays , free

age limit: 21 guys, 18 ladies

Nestled within the hip enclave of Club Street, HQ has slowly become the new headquarters for yuppies, creative types and celebrities to hang out at, within the walls of its quaint refurbished shophouse, distinctly black-and-white with a touch of pink. The open concept Karaoke and Bar opened by celebrity and FLY Entertainment CEO, Irene Ang, encourages social Karaoke, where strangers and friends at different tables take turns to play each other's audience and supporter. Sing your heart out to a gamut of songs - from popular English, Chinese and Korean choices, to the more exotic Thai or Vietnamese ones. The cosy melodic environment also calls for some soulful sipping, with signature drinks such as Soju Oolong Tea, Mojitos and Apple Shooters, along with an eclectic list of cocktails, wine choices and housepours. "Surprise Me" has also become a popular request, a personalised concoction by the friendly HQ bartenders, who will customise each drink based on each customer's personality. So come on down to experience for yourself a whole new level of karaoke fun! We are open 7 days a week, with happy hours from 5-30pm - 8pm daily. Pssst... we are wifi-enabled too!
Two-floor bungalow with a well-stocked wine bar, a lush outdoor seating area and DJ playing jazz and funky tunes, visiting this feels like crashing a Singaporean house party.

In keeping with Gaelic Inns' previous highly authentic pub investments here in Singapore, Durty Nelly's was designed and built entirely to scale in Ireland, and shipped lock, stock and  barrel to Singapore in three 40ft containers where it was re-assembled for the drinking public three years ago. The interior design has many beautiful traditional features and bric-a-brac, however the colours used and level of comforts afforded are more contemporary. The pub caters to the large executive crowd from offices in the area, and of course the many 4 and 5 star hotels surrounding this prime location. With the best of Irish hospitality and hearty Irish dishes such as Steak & Guinness Pie, Homemade Irish Stew and of course signature Fish 'n' Chips with mushy peas, Durty Nelly's never fails to delight customers from all walks of life. Durty nelly's serves up the best selection of ice-cold draught beers in singapore with 8 premium international beers on tap including heineken, tiger, kilkenny, guinness, erdinger weissbier, erdinger dunkel, old speckled hen, and strongbow cider. With a contemporary glass facade running the whole length of the pub and a great 'al fresco' decking area outside the pub, the design is also popular with event organisers for large scale post-convention cocktails. Durty Nelly's is also privileged to be one of the only 'watering holes' sitting right beside the fastest stretch of the Singapore Formula 1 Street Circuit, where customers have a unique audio-visual experience as cars race by at speeds of up to 300km/hr during the race period.

Something's brewing! WitBier Cafe ~ featuring a cool range of specialty beers and delicious bites amongst the rich historical Kampong Glam area at 32 Kandahar Street! Brought to you by the Team at Just Beers @ The Atrium!

About Club Lava 
Singapore's latest Underground Asian Boutique Dance club
Relish your late-night rendezvous at Club Lava, the Underground Asian Boutique Dance club and experience everything a mega club has to offer in an intimately scaled, modern twist of luxurious comfort. Club Lava differentiates itself from the mainstream VIP and promoter driven clubs by focusing on the quality of music, guest DJs, Asian celebrity showcase, audiovisual effects, as well as the affordability of VIP bottle services. Located at the basement of CHIJMES, Club Lava offers the same high energy you would only feel at the mega club. Club Lava showcases state-of-the-art sound and lighting systems that allow you to be engulfed with infectious beats of a high-energy club. Hit the dance floor with awards winning DJs: turn table legend DJ Andrew Chow; Scratch master DJ rattle, and Lady Pitbull DJ Yukie. The 3,500-square-foot space is intimately designed for a lush heart-thumping experience 
Club Lava will be the place to be for revelers looking for an extraordinary nightlife experience. Quality music, affordable drink prices as well as good party crowd are what attract club-goers to Club Lava
Adorned in colorful accents, futuristic architecture and LED table tops; Club Lava will be the perfect mix of high-energy, sumptuous design and intriguing sex appeal. Bottle service starts at $168 nett for a bottles Remy Club, and the posh VIP couch will give partygoers the ultimate VIP experience without burning your pockets

A stylish retro industrial Bar which brings a spark along Robertson Quay area. The bricks walls, mix of leather sofa and metallic chairs, and rustic wooden tables' décor create a warm atmosphere. Meanwhile, large opened windows surround the space, creating a spacious and airy feeling, seamlessly connecting the ample al-fresco area to indoor seating. Nested between the bar and the bistro areas, a stunning glass paneled wine cellar, stocks over 4,000 bottles of wines from around the world, ensuring perfect temperature of service. Wine Connection Tapas Bar & Bistro is the perfect place for:
Gathering after work around some home-made Tapas, while enjoying a drink from the extensive selection of wine by the glass or exclusive collection of imported draft beers. - A casual dinner with friends and family, to share classic Bistro dishes while sampling wines from all over the world. - Late night reunions to share more wine, beers or cocktails among friends in a lively atmosphere animated by a DJ from Wednesday to Saturday.
Cosy Pub with 5 sofa sitting , 5 standing table , pool table and not forgetting our always updating KTV system for singing......

Gem bar & Lounge is the jewel of Chinatown. It sits pride of place at the intersection of the famous Club St and Ann Siang Hill. There is no place better to capture all the energy and excitement of the crowds that frequent this special, historic part of Singapore. With the widest verandah in the whole strip, it's the ideal place to while away the evening and watch the passing parade of night time revelers. Gem is famous for its cocktails and food all made with a Gem-of-a-twist. The Star Fruit Martini and Sour Plum Mojito are two standouts by head mixologist, Alfee. It's a restaurant and bar first and foremost but come Wednesdays onwards, we have Singapore's top DJs spinning at the decks.

Sitting at the corner of pekin street and cross street in the heart of singapore's chinatown district, the bull and bear is far east square's latest restaurant and pub.
opened in august 2009, the bull and bear can best be described as a chic, inner-city chill-out bar catering to both sexes of our species with disarming ease! With both indoor and outdoor seating, a pool table and a bunch of big-screen televisions to catch all the live sport you can take, we think we've got the infrastructure right for the guys. And for the girls? A range of excellent food and drinks, as well as a modern, airy atmosphere that's bound to suit all tastes!

Jigger & Pony is a welcoming bar that focuses on classic cocktails, craftsmanship and precision. Named after the double-coned measuring device used by bartenders to accurately pour out liquid, Jigger & Pony is a tribute to the 19th century when cocktail recipes were listed in "jiggers" and "ponies". With a list of 24 cocktails spanned over 3 categories , cocktails at Jigger & Pony are concocted with premium spirits and meticulous Japanese bartending techniques. The team's attention to core and basic ingredients as well as rightful techniques result in top-class cocktails with unparalelled consistency and quality. Equipped with a full kitchen, warm and approachable interiors and a capacity  bigger than most local cocktail bars, Jigger & Pony is positioned to be a social space with "Good Food, Good Drinks" for the discerning cocktail lover.

5.text: The slick faux-Moorish decor inside is pleasant enough, but the thing to do here is to grab one of the hotly contested outdoor tables, fire up an expertly prepared shisha water pipe and watch the endless parade of Singapore's nightlife unroll before you. $12-15 for drinks.

Loof is a rooftop bar, offering a playful atmosphere filled with caged trees and colourful lights. It promotes itself as the 'canvas for the budding artist.' The place is cool with a quirky charm and drinks as eclectic as the people.

2.text: Bar/terrasse sur un toit de la ville, le Loof attire une foule éclectique et sociable. Un des bons coins de la ville. S'il pleut, la maison offre un deuxième verre pour l'achat du premier!

2.text: Club underground, le Home Club participe régulièrement aux lancements d'albums d'artistes locaux, et fait venir des DJs internationaux. Musique variée: hip hop, techno, indie, electro...

5.text: Low-key cafe with 40 types of beer and good thin-crust pizza. No air-con.

5.text:
This is our hood. A place where like-minded people who really dig great live music and free-flow art hang out. This is where we discover great local talents and put them on stage in front of a legion or handful of fans. This is the place where friends catch up, colleagues gossip and lovers make out in public. This is the canvas where art flourishes and people paint memories. This is our hood. And if you think this is where you belong, then this is your hood too. Band schedule:

KPO is named for its location at the junctions of Killiney, Penang and Orchard Road. The place offers ambiance, sophistication and modern design combined with history. KPO is the perfect spot for breakfast meetings and late night cozy get-togethers.

2.text: Bar sur 2 étages au design soigné, jardin interieur à l'étage. Ambiance relax et décontractée. Bonne carte de cocktails/bières.

5.text: At this Australian-inspired restaurant and bar, what you can expect is 'outback meets chic'. The key feature and highlight of the Barossa is the Long Bar where you can mingle with your buddies or BFFs, and enjoy a range of craft beers by Archipelago Brewery. The bar also boasts a range of new world wines and champagnes, and there's no shortage of your favourite shooters, Martinis and Mojitos. Its unpretentious, laid-back and rustic ambience makes it the perfect place to chill out after a hard day's work and tuck in hearty fusion Australian fare created only with the freshest Australian seafood and premium grades of Australian beef. Signature dishes like the Seared Pacific Scallop with Pancetta, Grilled Stockyard Prime Ribeye Steak, and Old Time Fish and Chips with Coleslaw are some of the comfort food you wouldn't want to miss.

It is testimony to the strength of the Irish Pub concept that Muddy Murphy's is one of the oldest traditional pubs in Singapore. The success of "Muddy's" is driven by having achieved that delicate balance between tuning in to the needs of local and foreign clientele whilst retaining an essentially Irish atmosphere.

Located at the Raffles Place entrance to Boat Quay, one of Singapore's most colourful and vibrant river front entertainment zones, The Penny Black Victorian London Pub is without doubt your quintessential Victorian Public House. And like its sister pubs in Singapore  it was painstakingly designed and built in England by master craftsmen and shipped piece by piece to Singapore where it was re-assembled by the same craftsmen. The name "Penny Black" is derived from the world's first ever self-adhesive postage stamp which was printed black in colour, sold for one penny, and first issued on the 6th May 1840. Designed and built in England and shipped and installed in its entirety to its present location at 26 & 27 Boat Quay, The Penny Black pub is a highly authentic representation of a traditional Victorian London pub created as a celebration of that first postage stamp from the UK's Royal Mail. The riverfront seating area provides the perfect setting for 'al fresco' drinks, whilst inside on the air-conditioned ground floor of the main pub building level is the wonderfully authentic Victorian London tavern has been re-created area with high tables and a long and inviting bar. The second floor upstairs 'Snug bar' atop The Penny Black provides a comfortable setting for informal business meetings, private parties / functions, air-conditioned lunches, and cocktails, and is still surrounded by the same warm London pub design ambience. Aside from local favourites Tiger, Heineken and Guinness, The Penny Black also has on tap Strongbow Cider, Old Speckled Hen, Kilkenny and Erdinger Weissbier. Food at The Penny Black is home freshly cooked daily, providing hearty meals at lunch times and extremely enticing local and western barfood in the evenings. Biggest sellers include Fish and Chips with mushy peas, Traditional Roast, and the mouth-watering home made Beef Burger.

TAB is a live performance and events venue. At close to 10,000 square feet, performances at TAB range from intimate live music gigs and stand-up comedy to various forms of dance and theatre. We have hosted a wide range of corporate and private events. At night TAB is host to SONAR - a unique club experience brought to you by the Neverland group. Sonar features our singers from around the region performing in english, korean, chinese and thai, along with a spectacular visual show from our vj mixing the latest korean and english mtvs. Be entertained by our resident dancers on our main stage and podiums while our resident DJs weave their magic with the latest club hits, electro and trance. SONAR is open from 9-00pm till 5,00am, Monday to Saturday.

It has been 20 years since Wala Wala first opened its doors. Our range of beers has always been the talk of the town. It wasn't the quantity of beers we carried, but the quality. Just like the first step on the moon, our draught beers have always made a mark in the beer industry opening many doors thereafter. Currently we have 7 draughts residing at Wala Wala. Notably we have Connor's Stout and Asahi's Premium Jukusen and Kuronama just to mention some. Come tuck into a wide range of hearty food offerings, which includes our signature pizzas and pasta. The laidback and homegrown vibe here is infectious. Chill out, let your hair down and enjoy drinks with friends and family. As for the bar above, come early to get seats and don't be surprised if you end up on your feet, singing along with some of the best musicians on our stage. Monday        : The Next Movement. Wednesday  : NTSB. Thursday     : Victor Tang . Thursday     : Shirlyn & The UnXpected. Saturday      : Shirlyn & The UnXpected. Open Daily from 4pm. Sat & Sun from 3pm. Sun to Thur close at 1am. Fri & Sat close at 2am. About Imaginings Pte Ltd ... The management company that brings to you Wala Wala Cafe Bar, KPO and Balaclava. Now the latest addition Nassim Hill & 1128.

Singapore's best-known nightclub and in fact a complex of 4 spaces: Zouk itself for harder dance music, Velvet Underground for loungier stuff, Phuture for experimental edge and the outside Wine Bar for chilling out. A full-entry ticket will set you back a rather pricey $35, but two drinks are included and the place is happening especially when foreign DJs are in town --- which is more often than not!

We've categorized our shots into 4 different categories: Deadly, Fruity, Yummy and Dare. With all-time favorites such as the Paddle Pop and the Milo Godzilla to insane shots like the Octopus and Black Absinthe Bohemian, we guarantee that there'll be shots to suit everyone!

Popular "New York style" club complex split into four zones: the outdoor 'lilypad' bar by the river, the main dancefloor , the inner chill-out courtyard and Attica Too, the members-only club upstairs . Picky bouncers, so dress sharp.

The perfect spot to simply relax with drinks & light bites, or a great place to meet before & after dinner. Hidden among the lush gardens of Dempsey, The Green Door effortlessly blends the line between indoor-and-out in an enchantingly reinvented way... a refreshingly unexpected experience awaits! Opening Hours:
Sunday to Thursday: 4pm to 12 midnight 
Friday and Saturday: 4pm to 1am 
Reservation Policy:
We only accept reservations for groups of 10pax and above

THE brand-new upcoming KTV Pub to be at! Affiliated with former Club Samurai at 29 Circular Road , we now bring you GIN PUB - bigger, better, and definitely your new second home! Features a pool table, dart machines, karaoke singing, and a friendly challenge to see who has the best time here!

The Vintage Room is a Champagne, Wine & Cocktail bar serving small bites and sharing platters. Designed with an eclectic and cosy atmosphere, it is the new great vintage place to hang out with friends on Duxton!

The birthplace of the Singapore Sling, a syrupy sweet pink concoction of pineapple juice, gin, cherry liquor and many mysterious ingredients. The two-floor bar is large and a bit of a tourist trap, but drinking a Sling at the beautifully decorated wood-paneled bar and throwing the accompanying peanut shells on the floor should be on every visitor's agenda --- if you can stomach paying $30 for a premixed drink poured out of a pitcher.

Pangaea is a one-of-a-kind Ultra-Lounge located at Marina Bay Sands. Created and conceptualised by Michael Ault, Pangaea has gone through several metamorphoses and has been seen in cosmopolitan cities such as New York City, London, Miami, Marbella  and Austin. Its latest reincarnation in the Crystal Pavilion of MBS is set to take the partying world by storm and once again revolutionise the global club scene. Like its ancient Greek namesake, Pangaea is a supercontinent of sorts, a place where entertainment is the currency and those who appreciate it finely are its citizens.

ALLEY BAR is Orchard's best kept secret, tucked in a snug passageway in Peranakan Place, the place has a cosmopolitan appeal that seamlessly weaves old-world charm with contemporary design. The Azzura Concept is the first of its kind in Asia. A multi-level entertainment, dining and hydrosports complex, built to portray a modern Asian outlook. Innovatively designed to creates a unique lifestyle experience for it's guest. Azzura is the new jewel of Siloso Beach, with stunning views of the sea amid swaying palms trees and warm sunny breezes. Azzura has established itself as the landmark for ultimate parties, celebrations, and entertainment and is fast building it's reputation as a party playground for jet setters, celebrities, VIPs, guests and visitors alike. Azzura is comprised of a large oceanfront complex featuring an outdoor beach club, restaurant and a elegant club on Level 2 called The Harem. Enjoy exquisite VIP bottle service on the beach cabanas and lounge beds during the day while you soak up the island sun. When the sun sets things heat up at ultra-lounge, The Harem . The Harem features a sexy and chic interior with multiple VIP areas as well as a champagne bar, coupled with the best in LED lighting and sound systems. Expect great music from our array of resident DJ's.

This state-of-the-art complex features a collection of performance and event spaces, including a 5,000 seat theatre, a multi-purpose hall, an outdoor amphitheatre, rooftop reception area, function rooms and supporting spaces of various sizes. This unique venue complete with stunning architecture and design provides a suite of performance spaces for a wide range of events from top concerts to intimate community events. Equipped with state-of-the-art technology, The Star PAC promises a unique experience and an audio-visual treat for event goers. The Star PAC is also adjacent to The Star Vista -- three levels of world-class retail and food and beverage facilities managed by CapitaMalls Asia. The Star PAC will be a one-stop-shop for all entertainment, retail and lifestyle options outside the hustle and bustle of the Singapore city centre. Located next to the Buona Vista MRT Station, it's easily accessible via public transport and close to a major highway with generous car parking facilities in the building. THE STAR THEATRE
Singapore's first and only 5,000 seat performing arts theatre. Complete with audiovisual capabilities, it is the ideal venue for concerts, musicals and seminars. THE STAR GALLERY
A versatile space designed for 800 guests in a theatre-style setting or up to 40 round tables banquet-style. THE STAR LOFT
Nestled atop The Star is an exclusive and private function space that accommodates up to 140 guests. The Star Loft opens up to a roof terrace overlooking the One-North precinct. THE STAR TERRACE
A casual, outdoor amphitheatre with bench seating for 300 guests offering a relaxed atmosphere for small showcases and community events.

Mambo is the perfect beachfront destination for friends and families looking for a relaxed upscale casual ocean front experience with a touch of sophistication and elegance. 5.text: Housed in a charming colonial mansion, Wild Oats offers elegance. Most popular drinks include the Lambrini, Emily Royale and Mumm's Champagne. A small yet delectable choice of food is offered - try out the popular Parmesan Wings or the Hot Bitches (known as hot dogs elsewhere) with chili con carne and sautéed onions.

5.text: At Sauce Bar, we believe that eating & drinking are a grand social affair that ought to be enjoyed heartily. The idea of sharing & choice are dominant in our menus, encouraging merry indulgence & heaps of random fun. Drunken nights often include our Cocktail Soiree & old fashion Punch bowls. Sauce Bar also harbours an age-old secret: delicious meatballs & inspired sauces, created by our Master Meatball Crafters.

A lush alfresco bistro and bar strung along Orchard Road. Outdoors Café & Bar is the perfect idyllic retreat for anyone looking to relax after a long day or to wind up for the night. Outdoors Café & Bar offers a full bar available all day and a tantalising menu with the best of East and West cuisines dished up daily.

The Vault occupies what used to be one of the earliest-operating banks  of OCBC -- a double-storey shophouse in the hip Chinatown enclave. Inspired by its colourful surroundings, The Vault's interior is an edgy mix of industrial copper and raw brick wall; a foil and backdrop to vibrant content and lively conversation. Tuck into fresh, hands-on foodfare at The Vault Bistro downstairs, where meals for two or more are a fun, engaging and real experience. Here, everyday gourmet fare is done right -- robust burgers, pizzas, pastas and much talked-about sidekicks  come to life when paired with spot-hitting mocktails or artisan coffee. Take your place at our high, communal tables or have a cosy tete-a-tete at a table for four. The Vault Bistro serves it up hot with seasonal items added to keep things delightful and fresh. Upstairs, a high-ceiling lounge with a laid-back ambience hosts private events and art exhibitions by up and coming talents throughout the year. There is also a quarterly Sunday Artists Market where The Vault transforms into a space for the creative set to showcase their work, presenting also an opportunity for anyone to hobnob with artistic types as well as commission works by artists at the venue. For reservations, please send your enquiries to

Party like never before with our guest DJs, MCs and dancers from all over the world. Dazzling lights, awesome music and a electrifying atmosphere; Club Avatar promises to reinvent partying.

WINGS BAR pays tribute to the great aviation years of the 1940's displaying memorabilia all over the restaurant. The pin-up girls, best wings and the best selection of drinks including beers and cocktails from around the world makes wings bar the perfect spot for a great night out.

5.text: Inspired by the last active writer's bench located at the 149th street grand concourse subway station in the bronx, the street art on the walls and numerous fixtures of rebel'hood are designed and executed by top local graffiti artists. The three main elements of graffiti art -- tagging, throw-ups, and characters, fuse well with the lighting and the dulcet beats of REBEL's resident DJs to create the perfect ambience of a "meeting point". An al fresco area offers the perfect respite for clubbers to sit back, chill out and watch the world go by. REBEL'HOOD's menu is conceptualized as a "black book" or a visual journal of an aspiring Hip-Hop cook. The food and beverages on the menu are named after key R&B or Hip-Hop influences and interesting sketches of some items are present on the "black book". Indulge in a hearty Snoop Hot Dogg with Relish and if you have a sweet tooth, try the tRIHANNAmisu. Quell the heat with a LL-ychee-Cool J cocktail or drown your sorrows with a shot of 2Pac-ked in REBEL.

A colourful beach front venue, Bikini Bar is a hot favourite with urbanites and the young at heart. This upbeat and vibrant beach bar boasts a wide range of ice-cold beers, cocktails and great music. Buzzing with life on a sunny afternoon all the way till late night, Bikini Bar is the perfect place to be. Whether it's catching live sports, lazing the afternoon away or simply playing some beach games, Bikini Bar has it all!

Named after Honoré de Balzac, the famous French novelist and playwright, the new Balzac Brasserie in Rendezvous Gallery serves up a slice of Paris the way its namesake does. Serving rustic French bistro classics, Balzac Brasserie is unpretentious and unassuming, but done with an amazing attention to details.

Nestled in the far reaches of the Dempsey Hill enclave and hidden from public view is a premium gastronomic  experience unlike any other. Located at 6c and 6d dempsey road, 酒庄jiu zhuang is inspired by the 1920s era in shanghai when china opened its doors to western civilisation. Designed in a neo-Siheyuan style with strong Chinese heritage influences, it transports the past to the present with its curated offering of luxe drinks and dishes celebrated in this modern age.
酒庄JIU ZHUANG  lives up to its namesake by offering an impressive selection of fine wines, champagnes, whiskies, sake and more, coupled with the delectable dim sum and Chinese 'little bites' that will satisfy even the most ardent fan. The establishment has two separate and distinctive areas. The indoor bar area  features the full Shanghai Tang décor treatment, lounge seating and a Chinese cabinet bar display backdrop. The alfresco & private dining area  on the other hand, feature Chinese inspired décor with an old turn of the century European twist, a walk-in wine cellar, and more organic outdoor friendly furnishings. The private dining section is also attached to an enclosed kitchen where the chefs display their mastery and serve up freshly made premium quality dim sum and Chinese food. Operating hours are from 5pm to 1am, Monday to Saturday and Public Holidays. New Sunday operating hours Sunday 11am to 10pm. Brunch menu available from 11am to 3pm; Dinner menu from 5pm to 9pm.

Housed in a 1910 Peranakan two-level shop house, this speakeasy is classic and unpretentious. Check out the cozy back bar where you can sit on soft cushions or recline on Persian carpets. Live music is played on level two.

2.text: Logé dans une belle demeure Peranakan, No.5 Emerald Hill est idéal pour boire un verre au calme entre amis et jouer à une partie de billards.

5.text: The Horse's Mouth draws inspiration from the izakayas of Japan, where a light atmosphere paired with tasty snacks and drinks provide the perfect location for friends and colleagues to get together. Our menu is backed by a strong selection of unique sakes, Burgundian wines and cocktails prepared on the spot by our mixologists using only fresh ingredients. In addition to our beverages, a selection of Japanese inspired snacks and sharing plates complete the Horse's Mouth experience and promise to tickle your tastebuds with every bite.

It is about procuring the best quality seafood, cooked simply, and most importantly, priced reasonably... you pay for what it's worth. This simple and singular pursuit stems from our belief in "less is only more, where more is no good", a guiding principle which you might say, translates into both our cocktails and seafood. Helping yourself to water and ordering at the counter saves us manpower costs, which helps us lower prices. It also means, no service charge. Don't worry, we will still deliver unadulterated and awesome seafood to your table, and clear your plates, of course. Our cocktails have always been guided by taste, quality and speed. With the outdoor dining environment, keeping it cold adds to the equation. Our journey has taken us to sorbet-making using fresh fruits, either blending it whole or juicing. With this approach, we are able to eradicate  dilution and yet maintain the cocktail at a much lower temperature , longer than conventional ice, which we believe will change the way cocktails are made for an alfresco setting.

Located right at the entrance of the Visitor Centre, offers a mixed menu of local and Italian food at slightly elevated prices, but this is still by far the cheapest and most casual place to eat in the Gardens. The best pick here is the large wood-fired pizzas from $20.

Station One Cafe, 4 Jalan Serampang , Taman Pelangi 80200. It serves mostly Western food, with a few local and fusion dishes. Prices of selected items in RM - lamb chop 18-90, chicken chop 13-50, grilled fish fillet 23-90, chicken lasagna 17-50, pizza 15-90 or 16-90, 'football platter' 23-90, chicken salad 13-50, hot dog 6-50, tuna croissant 7-50, chicken wings 9-90, French fries 4-50, baba rendang chicken rice 13-90, seafood tomyam soup 9-90, chilli tempura fish with rice 11-50. In addition, cold and hot drinks including beer, milk shakes 6-90 RM, ice creams, sundaes 6-50 RM and cakes are served here. All prices are subject to a 10% service charge only. No air-con. Free Wi-Fi Internet access and there are 2 flat-screen cable TVs in the restaurant. Open 8am to 2am daily. There are 5 other outlets in the city.

The legacy homegrown cake shop Temptations traces its roots to 1985 when its founders identified a niche in the quality and availability of gourmet cakes in Singapore at the time. In they stepped to fill the niche and success came fast as its signature etoile cake, amongst other delicious offerings, won the hearts of many foodies, dessert lovers and those who enjoy the finer things in life. Temptations has been reborn in 2010 - on its 25th anniversary - with the generation of its founding partner breathing new life into the familiar brand that many of us remember fondly. With a dynamic new management team at the helm, Temptations continues to be guided by one of its original founders - skillfully bridging the old and the new so that the company is now perfectly poised to reclaim its premier positioning amongst cake connoisseurs while preserving the cherished memories of yesteryear that made Temptations' cakes so unique and well-loved.

When you walk into our casual dining restaurant situated in a corner away from the hustle and bustle of the city, you will find our diverse guests from all ages, from all walks of life. You may be coming in to relax from a day's shopping at the exhibition or drive in from the open-air car park for a family meal; have your afternoon cup of Twinning tea or Illy coffee with our cakes or just enjoy your favorite Gelato flavors; or seal a rewarding business celebration with champagne. Whatever the occasion, you will let yourself into a relaxed and cool atmosphere. Vegetarians or those aiming for the all green option will also be spoilt for choice with our range of salads, pasta and pizza. Our venue makes a good function, meeting or networking option with free wifi and power point facilities, a one-stop convenience for both function room and customized food menu. Our alfresco dining space gives you space to chill out with a glass of wine, cocktail drink or beer or simply enjoy an icy cold juice or drink for a relaxing break. If you are on the run to your next appointment you may want to opt for a quick take-out meal. Those wanting to stay home or be in the office to catch up with some work will ask for our doorstep service or call for our customized good value catering service that starts from under $10 per head. Do drop by soon to and it will certainly be our pleasure and honor to assist you to experience your very own space to recharge and refresh. See you soon!

Here at Smitten Coffee and Tea Bar, we are dedicated to sourcing for premium quality coffee beans and tea leaves. Our passion is to deliver a perfect tasting cuppa to make your day. Trade customers, do come talk to us about wholesale coffee and tea supplies for your establishment.

Welcome to Picotin
Picotin is a European Bistro, situated in the lush greens of Bukit Timah. With its tranquil suburban feel, Picotin provides the perfect bistro experience for the neighborhood and beyond. Whether you join us to entertain or simply to enjoy our relaxed ambiance, our great client mix ensures that we have an atmosphere where no one is out of place. Under the care of Chef de Cuisine Steve Kaye, our kitchen serves wholesome, appetising and uncomplicated European cuisine 7 days a week. Helmed by F&B personality, Jacky Stevens, Picotin's famously welcoming bar offers a cosy pub-like feel, offering good beer, friendly faces and the latest live sports. Join us daily for fabulous food, fine wine, atmosphere and best of all, fantastic times.
Comfort food, casual lunches, cosy dinners, weekend brunches, afternoon high-tea celebrations, special occasions and get-togethers ... or simply spending time with a good book and me.

The Story Of BlackBall:
Drawing from the idea of 'Xian Cao' being 'black' in colour and taro 'balls', came the birth of BlackBall - a dessert connoiseur that has its roots in Taiwan. The company was founded and created by Mr. Tang, who is an experienced tour guide, when he came across 'Xian Cao' by chance upon travelling to 'Guan Xi'. He was thrilled and excited by what he had encountered, as not only did his new discovery taste great, but it also provided various health benefits. It was from this experience that his dream was born. This dream finally came true for him after setting up the BlackBall Company in Taipei, introducing his customers to the amazing characteristics of "Xian Cao". The ingredient has now become a key inclusion in most traditional desserts accross Taiwan. Having started the BlackBall company started back in 2006, has bloomed and now stands as one of the biggest dessert chains in Taipei with over 20 outlets and over 10 outlets in Malaysia. For franchising enquiry, kindly email to .

5.text:
High Society 
Nestled in the heart of the Marina Bay Sands Shoppes, the High Society Cafe is the latest addition to the High Society group/family of products and services. With its distinctive design of chequer Italian marble flooring, golden chandeliers, and white walls adorned with golden frames of red velvet, the Cafe exudes an old world charm of the good life with a twist of contemporary lifestyle living. As befits its cosmopolitan heritage, the food menu at the Cafe is an eclectic mix of East and West, ranging from local delights to modern European fusion. One of our best known offerings are the High Society cupcakes, all fondly named after our award-winning music CDs such as "flirt" and ''a love so beautiful''. An ideal restaurant for high tea, lunch or dinner, the High Society Cafe is also the perfect venue for corporate events and private parties, with 70 pax for dining and 200 pax for cocktail functions. To date, we have hosted several events for special guests at the MBS, ranging from the media industry and celebrities, senior corporate executives and avid theatre-goers. Working closely with our clients, we aim to fulfill their demands to create and customise the perfect setting and ambience to suit the occasion. Finally, to complete the whole offering of services, High Society carefully selects and curates a music playlist culled from our archives which is played non-stop at the Cafe. Come and experience music in a way you've never encountered before. And with that, we hope to feed your eyes, stomach and soul in one location... Welcome to the High Society Cafe.

The Godfather does not trifle with quality, especially in the creation of the world's finest gelato. Advocating luxurious indulgence, his spirit of perfection drove his men the world over in search of top quality ingredients to craft a gloriously palatable gelato. Pioneering gelato so unique is not a job for the faint of heart, yet its rewards remain substantial. Having mastered usage of Alfero Gelato's all-natural imported ingredients, the Godfather looks on in satisfaction as you entertain your guests in his humble indoor and outdoor seating quarters. Because, even the Godfather loves it.

Closed on Mondays. Nassim Hill is this spacious and welcoming destination where one can feel right at home having a breezy brunch with the family or savouring drinks after work with friends. Taking centre stage is an enormous counter that seats up to 20 inspired by what one might find in a medieval tavern but given a generous contemporary twist with the use of black marble. In a bid to encourage a convivial environment, customers are welcome to share dining space and mingle at this communal table as well as tap their own beers upon ordering. With the bakery section helmed by Head Baker Audrey Tan, who is also the owner of Freshly Baked, customers will be beckoned by an intoxicating aroma of daily-baked fresh artisanal breads and pastries as soon as they step in. The hearty Grimbergen Ambrée bread  is the first Grimbergen-infused bread in the world and an original creation of Chef Audrey. She elaborates: "When I first tasted the Ambrée, I was struck by its full-bodied quality and how it would be perfect in a hearty wholemeal bread. This dark bread carries the beer's distinctive caramel aftertaste while maintaining a sense of lightness in texture. You won't be able to stop at just one slice! " The bread's malty flavour also makes it the perfect choice for Nassim Hill's signature Hot Reuben  -- a veritable crowd-pleaser of emmental cheese that is perfectly melded with corned beef, sauerkraut and onions over the Grimbergen Ambrée bread. An ideal destination for evening drinks and revelry, Nassim Hill also serves a quality range of alcoholic beverages. Besides Grimbergen beers, guests can look forward to sips such as wines, Perrier Jouët Bellini ; Campari Soda ; Havana Club Lychee Mojito  and Pimms Lemonade . About Imaginings Pte Ltd ... The management company that brings to you Wala Wala Cafe Bar, KPO and Balaclava. Now the latest addition Nassim Hill & 1128.

Our Beliefs
We believe in using real ingredients for our products
At Merely, we avoid using artificial flavouring and colouring, or pre-mixes. Be it macerating fresh fruits or roasting and grinding nuts, the real deal is never far off. We'd rather toil long hours in the kitchen processing our own ingredients so that our customers get to taste the ice cream closest to their natural flavours. 2. We believe in disclosing what goes into our products
There are two reasons why we disclose our ingredients: Our customers have the right to know what they put into their mouths and more importantly, we are proud of the fact that our products are crafted using natural ingredients and free from artificial flavouring. 3. We believe in natural ice-cream without stabilisers and chemical emulsifiers
We make "French-style" ice-cream using egg yolks as natural emulsifier. Our ice-cream may melt faster than other ice cream but that's because we do not use any stabilisers in our creation. 4. We believe in selling pure, unadulterated ice cream
Our ice-creams are tasty in their own right. Hence we do not mask our ice cream with additional commercial toppings or sauces, which would compromise the original relish of our flavours.

Whether you are looking to pamper yourself with some art therapy or simply looking for a break in your fast-paced life with a cup of aromatic coffee. You can always be sure of a warmest welcome

The Au Chocolat bistro offers all day dining with a wide variety from crepes to gelato to cakes making it an unforgettable experience for the whole family. Ever since we were young, mom would bake for us. Lovingly, she was uncompromising with every detail. Using less sugar and icing, the cakes were not too sweet yet full of flavour. Every cupcake holds a perfect balance - less sugar, more flavour. Prepared and baked meticulously with 100% pure LOVE.

Milk and Honey is "The Promised Land" of four young entrepreneuristic close friends who chanced upon a petite yet a larger than life motherly lady who graciously led and tutored these young men with utmost commitment, passion, sincerity and generosity without whatsoever 
monetary returns. She imparted her lifeworks of an array of savories, sweet treats, gelato recipes and culinary skills, and also notably her spirit of excellence, courage and magnanimity to them. It is with such admirable characters that they aspire to build this business on in both good and bad times.
A self-service bistro and convenience shop.

Anyone who has ever baked a cake will tell you it's not rocket science. Butter, sugar, flour, eggs, beat together, chuck in the oven and -- bam -- you have cake. What no one talks about is what it takes to make a good cake. We think we have that bit down pat. Always bake fresh; day-old cakes never quite make the cut. Only use the best of ingredients; French butter, pure Madagascar Bourbon vanilla, bittersweet Belgian chocolate, perfectly ripe bananas. Skip the artificial preservatives. Buy from local suppliers; that way you know your eggs are fresh and your coffee beans newly roasted. Use seasonal produce so you'll always be getting the best of the crop. And never ever, ever take shortcuts. Sift that flour thrice, toast those walnuts and grate that lemon zest by hand just as you're about to use it. We won't lie to you; it takes a good dose of heart. We honour home baking traditions and keep our recipes uncomplicated, but we take the time to get it bang-on perfect. We mull over spices, chocolate and fruits and deliberate on how to refine familiar flavours. We think real hard about what we put in front of you to eat.
